Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pepere20
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Great breakfast every morning including bacon and eggs. Rooms small as per Europe. Location can't be beat. Walk from central station, walk to main sites. Ask for room away from street and you'll be quiet.l L

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not good to stay if u are sensetive to noise”
Reviews.Author: lefils
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days, nice and polite staff, good location and really nice and clean rooms. The only problem is the architecture, seems they have renovated the place from an old building into a hotel, the floors are made from hollow pannels so whenever some one walks you could hear a drum like sound in your room ( in ur floor or floor above). This made me wake up any time during night or early morning. Only for this reason i would not stay in this hotel for next time.Because of lack of sleep on last day i got so tired and sick. If you r comfortable with such noise ( boom boom) or can sleep with earplugs, I can tell u its a good hotel otherwise look for some other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service in central if basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: anutaNY
Reviews.Content: We did not pick the hotel and stayed stayed there only because our friends whom we were meeting in Amsterdam booked it first and we decided to follow suit. The location cannot be beat with 5 minute walk to central station, right on the Dam square. The hotel itself is basic and clean with an uninspiring but free breakfast. I do want to mention an outstanding customer service we have received from Hub, who went above and beyond in his efforts to help us. He was great with all the customers of the hotel, and it was not only because it is his job but because he is a great person and enjoys being around and helping people. Over the course of years we have stayed in many hotels including 5 star ones, and I can honestly say that Hub has singlehandedly blew them all out of the water. We left the city feeling like we have made a friend, and I do hope that we will meet him again. Thank you Hub for making our stay in Amsterdam so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “basic but fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: southbank10
Reviews.Content: to be honest the pictures probably look better but in terms of price, location & ease of moving around central amsterdam - can't get better. Staff were friendly & helpful and it was a great base. Would recommend looking on a number of sites as I made excellent savings on this booking with ba.com - yep fell off my chair too when they came up cheapest! good hotel and I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Allen P
Reviews.Content: The Rho is clean, neat and the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and very good! I had a room on the inside court, so it was very quiet but didn't get much natural light. The location is excellent, central to many places I wanted to go, including the tram and central station. My room was very basic, nothing fancy, but great for me because I don't spend much time in my room when I visit. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: DDutch01
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the RHO hotel for 3 nights the last week in march. we found the hotel to be centrally located off Dam square and good value for the money. while not everything was perfect; is room safe not working, telephone dialing directory lacking, we would recommend the hotel to those interested in exploring the various neighborhods of the original central city. The breakfast was quite adequate and offered warm and cold choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballymaguigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Rho hotel 3 nights over easter holidays.After much researching on TA we settled on this hotel.It is just a few steps off Dam Sq and easy walking distance to all other places.Amsterdam has many restaurants so you wont go hungry.The hotel is really nice and clean and the staff are very friendly.Breakfast is served in a beautiful bright and airy room there is all the usual things plus bacon and scrambled eggs and coffee is good.If we were to visit Amsterdam again we would stay here again .We also visited the tulip gardens which were very nice ,we went from the airport with connexxion buses about 21 e for two including tickets for park

Reviews.Title: “Best location, nice stuff, good value.... but could be improved....”
Reviews.Author: zevik61
Reviews.Content: As of working with Dutch firms since the 90's, have stayed at the RHO hotel many times during last ~20 years upon Amsterdam stop-by intervals - the unbeatable location is certainly the real advantage of the hotel (at the DAM square, the center of Amsterdam - most attractions are with walking distance), the stuff is nice & helpfull and the VFM ratio is fair - however some basic things have to be taken care - main fault is the water flow which is repeatingly not strong neither warm enough as you expect, especially at the top floors, which is quite annoying, maybe as showers are bit warn... free Wi-Fi is nice but relevant just at lobby hall, rooms have no connection... breakfast is OK but quite basic (do not expect much choice) and TV channel options are few & basic - as indicated, the value factor is OK as hotel location would be preffered by some, however after repeating visits one would expect some improvment to be made especially with much options near by.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: hennessiee
Reviews.Content: Upon walking in a was a bit worried, the lobby is bizzare. Its an old theater, which is awesome, but the decor is cold, outdated and just plaid odd. I felt better upon checking in when the staff at the front desk RAVED about how great our rooms where despite our late check-in. I realized when I arrived at my room they were making a joke at our expense. To get to my room I had to take an elevator up one floor, then a short flight of stairs up and thru a door, then ANOTHER short flight of stairs up. Once we finally dragged our luggage to our hotel room doors I opened it to find a flight of stairs DOWN into my room. It was tiny, dark, with one twin sized bed under the stairs (creepy?), the other pushed up against a wall of windows. Out the window was almost street level and it was a dark alley/courtyard area. The window locks did not feel at all sturdy. It made me very nervous but it was midnight and the hotel had no other rooms. Rooms were dirty. Decor was bad. Service was bad. No water pressure. Creepy. Icky. Dont do it!

Reviews.Title: “Such a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7KJM
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night there unfortunately. We are halfway through a 4 week European journey. After cramped London hotels the Rho was a real pleasure. Our room was spacious, but quite spartan in decor. ( but had everything we needed in excellent working order). It faced into the courtyard - so it was quiet , and was lovely and clean. The bathroom was large and the shower was fantastic and the twin beds were very comfy. I wished we were spending more time there. But the best thing about the Rho hotel were the guys at reception. They were so helpful, friendly and just good fun to deal with. They went out of their way to help us with any enquiry. It was quite a hike with wheeled suitcases and carry ons through evening pedestrian traffic from Centraal railway station, but we did manage it. Apparently we walked on the busy side of Damrak and if we had just crossed to the other side (left side going towards the rho) we would have fared much better. Overall I thought this hotel was an excellent choice and since we were travelling with another couple (we are all in our 50's) and I had selected the Rho, I was very pleased that they liked it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lothome
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off Dam Square in a good location. Rooms are comfortable and breakfast pretty good. All in all a good spot for a few days in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Erin D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great experience. The location - on Dam Square - is outstanding as it is close to everything. The hotel is clean. Rooms are sparse, but the hotel staff is OUTSTANDING! All of them were funny and friendly. They remembered us every day. It was like family. The breakfast is one of the very best I've had in a hotel. We had a couple issues day one with our shower and safe, but the staff came up straight away and fixed both.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- Great Staff- Best breakfast around”
Reviews.Author: barry t
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. Across the street from the Royal Palace. One street from the Red-light District. Half a block from most trams and one block from all trams. Rooms are typical european mainly bed and bathroom with little charm but the location and the breakfast (included with eggs and bacon) make this a good stay for anyone on vacation or business. --Negatives are that the building is dated and walls are thin. And with the location may be better for adult travelers without children. -- But If you want a good clean hotel- where all the action is located then this is a good choice. Even have rooms for single travelers. One of the best values for a good hotel in the center of town.- When arrving at central station hop on tram 4,16,24 or 25 and go one stop and you are across the street from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Spot!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa M
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of stying at the RHO Hotel Amsterdam. Firstly its location was to me one of the best in Amsterdam, directly on Dam Sq and walking distance from Central Station...There is a Tram stop directly opposite just behind The Palace..Needless to say I did not use the trams but they are are great way to explore the city. The RHO Hotel produces great maps with the tram numbers and stops showing, which is extremely useful, if ask the friendly reception staff, Christian or Natasha, they will be glad to help you in any way they can. Our checkin time for the room was 3pm...so we arrived early around 1100, unfortunately it was not possible for us to get early checkin as the hotel was fully booked the night before..but, after speaking to reception it was explained to me that, had it not been fully booked, early checkin could have been arranged..However, we were given the key to the lockup, in here we could store our bags until check in. As we were waiting we just popped around the corner for a relaxing beer, e2.50 (which is not bad at all) immediately there you could sit and soak up the nice atmosthphere!! We arrived back for check-in which was straight forward, as there was a group on 9 of us on a Hen Party, I had emailed the hotel previously to see if there were any surprise extras we could add...upon check-in we were told that we could try out the apartments which were larger, they had a kichenette with fridge, an outside smoking area...a very nice airy bathroom, livingroom and 2 bedrooms...this was excellent for our trip as we all met up here in the evenings...You can also buy drinks locally in the supermarket and keep them cool in the fridge..again these supermarkets are accessible to the hotel... We also had a triple room which was spacous, extreamely clean, and had a nice, airy spotless bathroom. The rooms were cleaned well. Cleaniness continued throughout the hotel.(spotless even though there are carpets) The hotel reception had a warm welcoming feel, nice to sit and relax in. Breakfast...was simple but good...Scrambled or boiled eggs, toast, bacon type, great tea coffee facilities...Cheese fruit...Ymmm pastries...Jam Museli yogurt...all very nice for a good start to the day...Breakfast started a 7 until 10...but I seen a few after 10..Best not be late for breakkie though!!! There are coffee and drink machines in hotel,,,Fizzy drinks and beer,,,Heineken of course which is a great beer and I have been totally converted, oh yes, and also its the cheapest as it local. EXCURSION...Hmmm, I didn't do any, but had planned to do Heineken factory from there you get a complimentry canal cruise taken you through the skinny bridge...girlies may enjoy Purses &Hand Bags Museum....numerous more.....all can be looked at in reception, there are flyers immediately as you go throught the door...***But to be honest with you...I have learned you never know how the days and nights will unfold in Amsterdam so preplanning your trip is not necessary...!!! NightTime.... We had prebooked a Dinner/Club ticket on escape.nl...e40 which was great, it included nice 3 course meal and VIP entrance into the night club, which was very modern clean...excellent place if you want a club..However you must book that on teh website...We were very glad we prebooked this. It was a great start to the trip. Red light District...We had a walk around, however there are dangerours parts so be very careful...also buying drinks can be expensive... Sooo, all in all my 2 day trip to Amsterdam was wonderful, I will be hopefully be returning in June to see a little more of the cultural city and I will defo be saying in the RHO Hotel.. Thank you again for pleasent stay. Lisa McNulty (Erne Travel) N Ireland....:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff and Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: johnstonei
Reviews.Content: This was a reliving the memories trip for my wife and I and we could not of asked for a better hotel in a better location for our trip.Excellent and very helpful staff ,Clean and well presented rooms . Breakfast was spot on for a day of sight seeing and there was plenty of itThe only thing that would of made it better was if there was tea and coffee making facilities in the room.There are vending machines in reception area. The room was serviced and freshened up on a daily basis .The jewel in the crown for this hotel is the location and value for money,it is situated about 10 steps from dam square and handy for all major attractions and some cheap but very tasty steakhouse's. We are coming back to amsterdam during the summer and will certainly be checking the Rho Hotel for vacancies before we book our accomodation. On Amsterdam its self the city has improved over the years and is much more tourist friendly and most of the street dealers and beggars seem to have been moved out of the area. A tip i would give to couples is to travel during the week as weekends with the stag and hen parties can get a bit rowdy as where during the week its still busy but not over crowded

Reviews.Title: “Would of scored it average , but location & free wifi everywhere makes up for this”
Reviews.Author: Petegaff
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and found it for â‚¬120 per night. I wanted a City center location and walking distance from Amsterdam central station (about 7 mins walk). All the reviews rave about the location and it's easy to see why. You are on the corner of the main square, very close to shopping and opposite Madam Tussauds, yet about 5 mins walk to Chinatown, red light district / coffee shops area. Reception area is grand looking and spacious with plenty of lounge seating. Staff were friendly and efficient. Room was OK but not fantastic, there was a safe, flat screen TV, shower but no bath, hairdryer, toiletries, plenty of quality towels and free wifi everywhere (in room or reception). The bed was a little compact for 2 but we managed a good nights sleep. Breakfast was buffet style and there was plenty of choice. Overall would use again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mschneider
Reviews.Content: RHO is a good budget hotel which provides excellent value for money in a good location. The hotel doesn't give a good first impression, the lobby looks a bit worn and it is need of some freshening up. But my room on the second floor across from the elevator appeared to be recently remodeled, and was excellent! There was new carpeting, new furnishings, walls were freshly painted, and a new bed. The room faced the courtyard, and I had no issues with noise. The price can't be beat, especially if you book well in advance via the hotel's site, and it includes a free hot breakfast buffet which was excellent! Location is excellent right off Dam Square...in the middle of all the action. Next time I'm looking for a budget hotel in Amsterdam I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: agtaistealandomhain
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and in a very central location within walking distance of everything. The walls are rather thin which meant that if other guests on the same or higher floors were noisy there was a high chance of them waking you. The hotel is very warm, don't turn on the rad and do open the window for a nice night's sleep. We had a room at the back of the hotel and it was very quite, only noise from ouside was chatting during the day as there is a bike-hire place there. Breakfast was lovely, small selection of juices but otherwise perfect. Very impressive reception area with lovely staff who have excellent english. Luggage storage the day we left was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: jackiemcseveney
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at this hotel and have found it very good. The staff are very friendly especially the gentleman who checked us in on Friday morning!! the rooms are basic but very clean and have a TV and a small fridge, tea and coffee making facilities would have been good but maybe that's an english thing!! you can get tea and coffee from a vending machine in reception. The breakfast was EXCELLANT! a good choice of hot and cold dishes, I reccomend the hot fluffy pancakes with 'stroop' sryup scrambled eggs and bacon!! another great service this hotel offers is baggage hold, so even though you have to check out by 11am and your flight or other onward travel is not until later in the day this hotel will safely and securely hoold your luggage for you to collect later at no extra cost!! I will definately stay at this hotel again when i'm next in Amsterdam and would reccomend it 100% to all my friends and fellow travellors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beanmhi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while back and was pleasantly surprised by room and availability of lift!! Anyone who has stayed in central Amsterdam will be familiar with the tall narrow buildings that require climbing many flights of stairs to reach your bedroom. The rooms in Rho Hotel were very clean, but still on the small side. Although just off Dam Sq it was very quiet at night and we slept well. Breakfast was lovely with a great variety and staff were very friendly. Within walking distance of many attractions, shops, restaurants, bars and train station. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: Neat B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times, and have booked again for this year. It has everything you need. Ideal location, cracking breakfast and clean rooms. On the down side some rooms are a little poky but as we don't spend much time in there it's not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... great location!”
Reviews.Author: womblelina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2011 and was amazed at the location and quality. The room we got had 2 singles, very nicely sized room (be warned we did hear from some guests that their rooms were on the small side)... breakfast was very good with a whole selection of packed goodies, so if you felt the urge you could always take something back to your room. We were lucky enough to be at the back of the hotel so it was extremely quiet, but again, we spoke to a couple of people who said their rooms were either at the front and got noise from the street or were by the lift. All in all a good hotel, pretty good value for money with it's central location, but I would not say this is a budget hotel. Can be pricy, but that's the price you pay for such a great location. We would often go back to our room for a quick nap early evening and then wonde the streets in the early hours right through till dawn. Down sides were: Safe did not work, neither did the fridge (we actually locked out belongings in the fridge as it has a lock on it???? god knows why) Bin in room is tiny.... and I would opt to take my case down to central station rather than leave it in the store room, as with many hotels in Amsterdam (this one is not the exception) when you come to get your case they suddenly slap an additional bill on you claiming damages were found in your room or the room was overly dirty. But apart from that not a bad hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “great location good service and perfect breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dfundfun
Reviews.Content: You must have reservation few weeks before otherwise you will not find a room... Located in a quiet street very close to dam square. Nice hotel we will defenetly come again.

Reviews.Title: “13th trip to amsterdam.worst experience”
Reviews.Author: desquigley1981
Reviews.Content: This was my 13th stay in Amsterdam and by far the worst.our room was the size of a shoe box.my 2 friends wer on another floor and there room was a lot bigger.our bathroom was a wet room meaning its a toilet and a shower in 1 room with no shower curtain so if I wanted to go to toilet after gf had a shower the whole bathroom floor would be wet. I booked this hotel because I seen on a website that it was ok to smoke in.goin to my room everyday was a smell of smoke in the coredoor.the bin in the room was tiny so we had to put rubbish in a shopping bag which we left neatly. I was shocked on checkout when the guy at the desk tried to charge 70 euro for cleanin.he came across extremely aggressive and arrogant.all the room needed was a Hoovering and a window open and that does not cost 70.my gf felt she had to give the 70 in case we couldn't get our case back out of lock up.we've never felt this ripped off anywhere we've stayed!Ive been around the world in different hotels and I've never been treated like this.the city is beautiful but stay clear of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great location great staff”
Reviews.Author: luganoPerhshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the rho hotel for 3 nights at new year for my 60th birthday with freinds and the staff at reception couldnt be more helpful . On my day of departure my flight wasnt untill the evening . My health wasnt to good that day. They let me stay in the room for as long as i needed it and asked if there was anything else they could do.First class. The location of the hotel is good just of dam square walking distance to shops bars resturants.Rooms are clean and a good size.Great breakfast. Will be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location and surprisingly quiet!”
Reviews.Author: MarkGoodl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for three nights in feb 2012. And agree with everything everyone else has said really. the location for sightseeing is excellent with only a 15 to 20 minute walk from the main station and nothing is more than about 20 minutes away. Upon arrival, we were given the choice of 3 different rooms, the 1st one was a proper double bed but the room was VERY small and not ideal for a three night stay. the other two were quite a bit larger but had two singles which we thought would be ok, and the room we opted for had a proper bath (with shower atatchments) although we were right next to the lift we could hardly ever hear it and it certianly didnt stop a good nights sleep which is something i seem to have trouble with in most hotels. Again, a common comment is that the breakfast is very good, and yes it is. on the face of it it looks nothing special and it has all the usual suspects it just seems the quality of the produce is very good. if i did have a complaint it would only be that the room seemed to get very hot at night, but we were on the top floor, however this was soon remidied by turning off our rooms heating at night. Overall, if your going to amsterdam to see the sights you could do a lot worse than stay here, and when we next return to Amsterdam, we will certainly be staying at the Rho.

Reviews.Title: “quite good choice near everything in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: driber9
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my family, in fact i'm writing this from the same hotel, it's a very good choice if you don't wat something expensive, but don't wanna stay back in being comfortable and well located in such a beautiful city as amsterdam is. very big rooms, clean, big lobby, and exceptional breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BDeMaert
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself: Located next to the Dam Square and a short walk from the train station. Airy lobby, friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast buffet with plenty of choice. The room: This can be a bit tricky, as the hotel is made up out of adjoining houses, there can be a few stairs you need to take before you get to your room. If you are traveling with lots of luggage, a small child in a stroller or someone in a wheelchair you'd better opt for a room close to the elevators. The rooms itself are more than adequate, with a decent sized bathrooms with all needed amenities. Wifi internet is free of charge, but you need to ask an access code at reception, speed is decent; however note that it can slow down quite a bit (I stayed there while there was a trade show happening in Amsterdam, and once all the business people got into their rooms the speed dropped significantly). However it's free so there's no reason to complain about it really. Depending on the room you have you could have slight noises of the street seeping into the room. As the hotel is next to the Dam Square you are plain in the city center and everything can be done on foot. Definitely a hotel I'll be considering again when staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shersche
Reviews.Content: 1st holiday to Amsterdam as a couple, hotel centrally located in Dam Square, open 24/7, shops, bars, restaurants just outside the hotel. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful especially when I had a problem with the roaming on my phone, breakfast was good & a wide range to choose from. Room was average, a bit small but as we spent very little time in the room we didn't bother asking for a room change. Try and ask for a high floor room as area can get quite noisy in the evening & early morning. Cleaning was great, towels changed everyday, shower gels, soap, shampoos etc given if used up daily. 2 computers available which one can use without paying extra. Would def stay again in this hotel & recommend to my friends & family!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ali_Iran_shiraz
Reviews.Content: The location is the best in Amsterdam for sure. My room was clean including refrigerator, hairdryer, safe box and free high speed internet. Breakfast was great including wide range of foods, drinks and fruits in a restaurant with nice old chairs and stone tables. The rate was very valuable during my travel date in end of January. Itâ€™s a perfect hotel for the people who donâ€™t look at number of hotel stars!

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel.. right in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: gfernan123
Reviews.Content: prior our visit, I sent a note with some questions via email and they answer right away, promptly. great small hotel, cheap for the location. Clean for the price. and the breakfast.. oh my.. GREATEST HOTEL BREAKSFAST WE HAD IN EUROPE (sorry Paris)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay; Clean & big room”
Reviews.Author: djarum
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very centally located in Dam Square from a short walking distance to Central Station. Our room was big and clean. It was not noisy during the night since our room was on an upper floor. Our trip was a weekend trip for sightseeing and enjoying the city so we didnt stay much in the hotel room. It was decent for a short stay. Although it was expensive for a 3 star, we were happy with the location and the breakfast (warm eggs & hams & sausages & pancakes & packed cookies & fruits & cornflakes & juice & coffee etc) of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: keano23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located beside Dom Square in Central Amsterdam and within an easy walk from Central Station. The location is perfect as it is just a little bit off the square and although it can be a little noisy depending on where your room is situated it is very convenient for accessing the attraction of which Amsterdam has many. The staff in general are very helpful and pleasant and you do get a very good buffet breakfast both hot and cold which runs fro around 7.00am until 10.30am. The rooms although fairly basic are clean and tidy and really are fine for what is required. Amsterdam is an expensive place these days and the Rho I would say is in the middle regarding the cost of hotels in Amsterdam. They really do have a very helpful reception area which is a major strength for this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but I think better deals could be had elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CptChunderpants
Reviews.Content: Good central location Clean Good Breakfast Nice Staff couldn't ask for much more, but if you are going to use the Tram then much cheaper accommodation could be found elsewhere, maybe up near the Hard Rock Cafe, the nightlife there is better than near Dam Square

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsHtoBe130612
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a triple room. Room and bathroom were both spotlessly clean. Overlooked the alleyway which was a little noisy when people walked past but nothing to warrent complaining. Breakfast was good with hot/cold food available. Rho hotel was a 2 second walk to Dam Square and 5 mins to the Red Light area. Staff were fab, very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Location & Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: claireboo
Reviews.Content: A large group of mixed ages stayed in this hotel while celebrating a 21st birthday, they was also a disabled member in our party and they catered to his needs fantastically. The hotel is ideally located just off dam square (next to the giant yellow clog) and in great reach for the usual tourist attractions. The rooms on first glance are extremely large with a connecting large bathroom very clean and basic. However they did contain all the standard necessities including TV, in room safe, hairdryer and a selection of toiletries. PLEASE NOTE â€“ they do not offer tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but you can always take your own! The staff on the reception desk were extremely helpful and catering to all our needs, there was also a luggage hold to use which was handy as you didnâ€™t have to drag your cases around with you on departure day. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and there was a large selection of breakfast which was all of a good quality and there was something to suit all tastes including a selection of refreshments. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a centrally located hotel offer a clean basic base to enjoy the sights and wonders of the surrounding Amsterdam location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: BridieHampshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a group trip to Amsterdam, the staff at the Rho Hotel, were very helpful, nothing was too much trouble for anyone at all. Rooms were very very warm and that was just with the hot pipes. Excellant choices at breakfast, location couldn't be better, you have everything on your doorstep. Only downside in the hotel was lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. that's all, would stay there again. It has free wifi too

Reviews.Title: “Basic Comfort - Hell of a location (in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: Hen A
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice place to stay, basic but clean rooms, big buffet breakfast and helpfull and friendly staff - Rho hotel is the one for you. Not to mention the REALY REALY GREAT location - 30 seconds (yes, seconds) walk from Dam square and 10 min for the central train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: asmad69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend from 2nd to 4th December in two treble rooms. Hotel Rho is in a great location just behind Dam square. 5 mins walk to Red Light district. 10 mins walk to Rembrandt Square. The hotel is quite large by Amsterdam standards in this price range, with large rooms and very comfortable beds. If you have been to Amsterdam before, you will know most budget hotels have never ending staircases which are more like ladders and hard to climb with a suitcase, or a few to many beers. It's not like this in the Rho. A large lobby with a lift, and proper wide staircases make getting around easy. Amsterdam and Rome are the most expensive cities in Europe for hotels. we checked all the price comparison sites for hotels, but booked through the link on the hotels own website which took us to hoteliers.com. by booking here in advance we got a further 10% off the price. Our rooms were quiet and facing an alley to the side of the hotel. didn't hear any noise from outside. on the Saturday morning we did hear some noise from people slamming doors on their way to breakfast, but this was around 9 to 10am. We never made it down for breakfast, so can't comment on that. From what I saw of the dining room it looked good, and was quite large. There are some vending machines in the lobby and a small bar if you fancy a drink. The staff were great at all times. I would definitely recommend staying here if you are looking for great value for your money and a central location. 5stars!

Reviews.Title: “RHO review”
Reviews.Author: 123Naj
Reviews.Content: Giving it 4/5 for 2 reasons; prime location and good breakfast. Room akin to travelodge/premier inn or similar. Clean but unremarkable except for oversized semi-grandiose lobby. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dekabrina
Reviews.Content: Positive: Excellent location - 10 min from Central station, next to the Dam square Friendly reception staff Good breakfast (even though not diverse) Negative Old hotel Very - very basic room Old & used towels, poor bath accessories, problems with hot water Overall not a very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “our hotel in amsterdam !”
Reviews.Author: rachelyTelAviv
Reviews.Content: the excellent location, helpfull staff and very good breakfast makes rho hotel our home in amsterdam. even the small bad will not change our rating. central station is very close and the only time we used train was to schiphol airport.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: jpark66
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Rho Hotel, we were a party of 5 women and we had an absolute ball! The location of the hotel is right at Dam Square you can walk to just about everywhere. We took the train from the airport to Central station and the hotel is about a ten minute walk. The value was terrific which included a hot breakfast buffet, bacon scrambled eggs, salmon, cereals etc... The staff are very friendly they all went out of their way to help us with information, they were always friendly and cheerful towards us. The rooms are big (compared to most hotels in Amsterdam) and very clean. Tip: ask for a quiet room, the front of the hotel the rooms can be noisy early morning! Overall I would certainly go back to the Rho Hotel and will recommend to friends! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Holey Linen - and I don't mean Shroud of Turin!”
Reviews.Author: Melbie32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June'11 - our bed linen was ripped and full of holes, when we reported this to the front desk they didn't seem to care and when we asked if we could have the linen changed, they said it would get changed in the morning, in other words we had to sleep on ripped sheets! God knows what they had been through. The rooms are not air-conditioned and it was stiffling hot - the hallways areas were air-conditioned, so whilst in our room we jammed the room door open as the desk fan in the room was of no help. The location can't be faulted but with the linen and the heat (35c) and lack of interest from the staff it wasn't a very nice experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location seals the deal”
Reviews.Author: Voyager1977
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very central. All local visiting points are very near. Eateries, Bus tram stops and museum etc. The hotel is well equipped will all facilities, The rooms are clean and neat. Breakfast buffet is good. Since the tram stop is very walkable its becomes very accessible to the full Amsterdam city. The hotel has an elevator, which is very rare in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location,value,friendliness of staff: unbeatable!”
Reviews.Author: Perpetuatraveller
Reviews.Content: I have lost count of the number of stays at the Rho...certainly about 20. I simply wouldn't even think of going anywhere else. So central... Easy walking distance from the railway station. Spacious rooms, lightning fast free wifi, fab buffet breakfast, charming staff always eager to please, great value for money. The downside? The two lifts are painfully slow. The hotel isn't high rise, so walking up and down woukd be fine for many peple, but tbe hotel is quite a labyrinth and it is easy to get lost! The hotel is entirely non-smoking. Great for non-smokers but a sadness for the we who hate having to go outdoors for a cigarette. I so wish my beloved Rho would designate a FEW rooms as smoking permitted.... I would stay more often, and/or for longer if that happened! And a number of people I chatted to, as we met outside the hotel for our cigarette moments, were equally disappointed that there were no rooms for smokers. It ia such a great place to stay. Reinstating the smoking-permitted rooms would make it even better!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: jeva72
Reviews.Content: -Very central location -Smiling, friendly staff, they were always helpful -Good breakfast -Well cleaned big rooms -Available luggage room -Just a little big negative: I didnt knew, they reserved 60% of my full price by my credit card before my arrivals.By the way, it was a correct price, but they didnt tell me about.

Reviews.Title: “A bit basic but so central”
Reviews.Author: heatheruth
Reviews.Content: Being within walking distance of the Central Station was a great bonus, although I'd say it was a 15 minute walk with luggage, plus allowing for all the trams and bicycles which considerably delay crossing the station plaza. We had asked for a quiet room, and were very glad to get one overlooking an inner courtyard, which was very quiet. Our room had an annoying pillar right between the wall and one side of the bed, making it a bit tricky to navigate without mishap, but the room was clean and warm, if a little small. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, and breakfast was excellent. The main lobby is very attractive but away from the public areas it all felt a bit basic. It wasn't cheap enough to compensate for the 'hostel' feel so we wouldn't return, but if location is important then it certainly wins on that score.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Fran727
Reviews.Content: I asked for a room in a quiet location and was given room 325. My list of Pros & Consâ€¦. Pros: - Hotel is near Dam Square. (This could be considered a Con.) - Art Deco lobby. - Front desk staff is excellent. Helpful, professional and friendly. - Room 325 has air conditioning. We used the A/C once. We arrived on a sunny October afternoon and the room (with the window closed) was very warm. - Very clean, updated bathroom. With a shower, no bathtub. - Refrigerator in room. - Strong wifi in room. A printer and two computers were available to use near the lobby. - The breakfast buffet was good, better than I expected. - Room 325 was quiet, but there is no view. We never hard any noise through the window or outside our door. Cons: - The bed in room 325 is too soft. (Two twin mattresses pushed together.) It was OK for a few nights. Someone with back problems would not want to sleep in this bed. The sheets, although clean, were thin and worn. - The window shade has dirty black marks on it. The curtains need to be cleaned. - Several small stains on the ceiling. Dust accumulating on the exposed pipes behind the TV. - The lighting in room 325 is dim. The room has good natural light during the day. After sunset, the lamps werenâ€™t bright enough. My husband said he would stay at the Rho Hotel again. I might return, only if the room has a good quality mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights and the staff were good - the rooms were clean and quiet despite being in the centre. Not too far to the station and central for everything. All in all a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “best location for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: grundster
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel a couple of times mainly because of its location. Set just off Dam square,walking distance from Central Station and most major tourist sights. Breakfast always been good but the cups a little on the small side for us english who like a big mug of coffee in the mornings. Beds and rooms have always been comfortable and clean. First time we stayed bathroom was huge with full bath, second time we stayed got a much smaller bathroom with just a shower so if you like a bath you would need to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Hold !”
Reviews.Author: Edward L
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using my visa debit card. A week before arrival, the hotel put a 60% hold on my card. I paid for my stay in cash upon arrival. It is now over 7 days and the hold remains on my card, I have emailed the hotel but they have not answered. I would not use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: SissyBar
Reviews.Content: My second stay in Rho. Almost everything was nice. The staff is very friendly and there's always more than one present at the reception but perhaps sometimes they concentrate more on chatting than their tasks as one day of them gave us a key that was not into our room but someone else's! The breakfast is good and breakfast room spacy and clean. Our room was rather small but it's nice to have a fridge and a safebox. One morning the hot water stopped running. The location of Rho Hotel is almost perfect.

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: 9chuckademus9
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant in reception and helpful. Missed breakfast sadly but a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: moony606
Reviews.Content: Right in Dam Square, this hotel took us by surprise in the lobby. It was very extravagant and interesting. The room, however, was very old but the bathroom looked newly renovated. So we had a good balance. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The view out our window was another brick wall, but I guess that's to be expected. As long as no protests are going on in the square at the time, this is a great place to stay and decently priced during off season months.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff..”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeDianne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rho Hotel in Amsterdam for four nights. The staff was very helpful..one even made a dinner reservation for us. The room was clean and the breakfast was plentiful. It was located within walking distance of the Central Station. We would recommend the RHO Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emmabpink
Reviews.Content: The Rho's location is great right off Dam Square. Staff were all friendly, rooms were ok basic but clean however our room smelt like stale smoke wasn't too bad but could smell it when walked in. Theres no air con however theres a fan in the room which helped to keep it cool. Theres also a fridge and a safe in the room. The bed was really comfortable and breakfast was lovely with a choice of pancakes, eggs, bacon, different breads, ham, cheese etc. We would stay again mainly for the location and that the breakfast is included in the price. If you just want somewhere to sleep whilst in Amsterdam its ideal, if you want luxury stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DC99080362
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend and found it too be clean, a good price and a tremendous location. The safe is an added bonus. found the staff helpful and friendly and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TTami
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, and breakfast nice, but other than that I was disappointed. Uncomfortable bed, old furniture, unpleasant bathroom, and towels. I thought I would get more for the price that was paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: singletraveler040
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept 27 2011 - Sept 30 2011. Had room 005, booked a single room and when I checked in they gave me a triple bed room. Room had three twin beds in it, bathroom was very big, no a/c, has a small fan, small fridge, desk area, two chairs and table, dresser/closet with safe. Bathroom come with a hair dryer and shampoo, body soap and hand soaps. Rooms are clean and was able to open one window. Wi-Fi did not work well at all, there were quite a few people in the lobby/bar area with their wi-fi devices. My room was on the ground level opposite the parking garage which might have had something to do with the poor wi-fi signal. Hotel is centrally located, we walked from the main train station to the hotel and it takes about 10 minutes depending on time of day, was about 15 minutes to Anne Frank house and Jordaan area, about 20-25 minutes to the Heineken experience, House of Bols, Van Gogh museum and the Tropen and Resistance Museums. About 5 min walk to red light district. I will stay here again if/ when I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tourist75
Reviews.Content: RHO hotel gives exellent value for the money. The location is great. Just off Dam square, close to the train station (great when you use the train to and from the airport). Everything in walking distance; shopping, eating, the canal cruises (nice way to see Amsterdam). The rooms are quite small (or the "layout" of some of the rooms are a bit strange), but the bathroom is huge in comparison. The room and bath room seemed very clean. There was no air conditioning, so I guess it can get hot in the summer (there was a fan in the room). I see that some was troubled by noise from the streets at night. We had a room at the 4th floor facing kind of a back yard. It was very quiet, so ask for a room on the higher floors. The breakfast was a buffet with a good selection of hot and cold food, bread and everything you need. DidnÂ´t miss anyting. The reception staff was very nice and spoke good english and the check in/out was fast, no problems. The only negative thing i can think of is that the cleaning staff didnÂ´t give us new toilet paper when they cleaned the room. All in all, a very good experience. I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location.....”
Reviews.Author: DR40
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just off Dam Square so great for walking to all of the attractions and for great bars and restaurants. Hotel was clean, rooms fine although very small (however bathroom was enormous!). Breakfast the usual types of cereals/meats/fruit/breads etc. Great for a couple of nights stay although it could get a bit noisy late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value but not always quiet”
Reviews.Author: Cudrefin
Reviews.Content: I selected the Rho Hotel as a base for a 4-night trip to Amsterdam with my wife and daughter as the reviews on Tripadvisor were generally good. I was also influenced by the attractive room rate although I was slightly dubious about the hotel location as (knowing Amsterdam reasonably well) it was only a few metres from Dam Square and fairly close to the bars and fast food outlets of Damstraat (there are also a few bars down Nes). Check-in was very easy even though we arrived mid-morning and the reception staff were great (in fact the reception staff were great throughout our stay). The hotel is a converted theatre so the layout is a bit 'different' to a purpose-build hotel. Access to our room on the ground floor was via the entrance to the hotel car park which is internal to the building. Our room was large with 3 single beds and a good-sized bathroom and was very clean. There was no view to speak of from the windows as the room faced onto an alleyway and the lower windows had patterned glass (for privacy I guess). The room was equiped with a television and a fridge. There was a safe but it didn't seem to be working. There was a fairly limited range of channels to choose from on the television (13 I think of which a couple were English-speaking news channels) and the picture quality was not great but was good enough to work out what was going on (who goes on holiday to watch television anyway?). The beds were very comfortable and the shower over the bath was perfectly adequate. Breakfast was of the buffet style and you just pitched up, got yourself a table and helped yourself to food and drinks. There was a good selection of hot and cold foods and drinks and I was more than happy with the quality of the breakfast. It could get busy at times but we always managed to find a free table. The only negative point I can raise about my stay at the Rho is the level of outside noise at night from people partying until 4am or even 5am. This is probably not as much of an issue if you don't have a ground floor room or if you're a bit of a party animal and are out until the early hours of the morning but for families this could be a problem. The noise didn't keep my daughter awake but I'm a very light sleeper and I did wake up many times in the early hours of the morning due to people in the streets talking and scooters whizzing around. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable, reasonably priced place to stay in Amsterdam and you want to be in the heart of the action. If you are looking for a bit of tranquility and luxury then pay more (probably a lot more) and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Devon_girls
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 12 and were struggling to find a decent hotel at a reasonable price and found a deal here. The hotel exceeded my expectations. The reception staff were fantastic and could not do enough for you. The rooms wer clean and comfortable and breakfast was very good with plenty of choice! The best thing is the location though - it was just perfect for us! Right in the centre of the good part of town! Will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelln-twosome
Reviews.Content: If you have a huge budget and want luxury then this is not the hotel for you...stay around the corner at the Grand Krapolsky... but if you want the same great location on a more modest budget I can happily recommend the Rho Hotel. Yes, the decor is a bit tired looking, but the room we had was a good size and very clean. The staff were helpful and pleasant and the breakfast buffet was great. We are two sixty somethings and had no trouble walking to the Rho from the train station with suitcases on wheels. It took less than 10 minutes. I would certainly stay there again if we were to go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: jintykerr
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a weekend, if you are looking for a basic 3 star centrally located hotel, then this is ideal. We were in the annexe room which was quite large, a bit sloped, so if you have one to many then be aware!!!Breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold food and it is served until 1030am.I definately would recommend this hotel to friends, ideal for groups and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location price and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Bound4BAnNOV
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Amsterdam and the Rho Hotel. The location is ideal and it was clean. Being American I missed having the availability of ice machines, but the hotel staff gave us ice anytime we asked. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: orgaleader
Reviews.Content: + The hotel is very centrally located, just off Dam Square and in walking distance from many attractions. 2 minute walk to the castle , 10 minute walk to the central station, 5 minute from the red light district. It is in a side street so there is no noise from the active nightlife of Amsterdam. Breakfast was good enough with good quality and variety, at least for us. The rooms were clean and most of the staff was friendly and willing to help us. There is free WiFi in the lobby and in the room. (sometimes it was down) - The hotel has very thin walls between the rooms (sometimes is annoying) , no a/c in the rooms ( was a bit hot even though it was September because there is just one window in the room. The room we got when checked in had problem with hot water but the guy at the reception was more than willing to check on it and give us another room.

Reviews.Title: “very central!”
Reviews.Author: vafa
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel mainly based on the location, and it proved to be the right decision. RHO is located some 10-15 meters from Dam square, which is a really central in Amsterdam. The lobby is really big area which can serve as a good meeting point for guests. We had 2 rooms there, none of them had views but looking to small patios and other rooms windows. 3rd. floor was signed as a no smoking area, but the smell of smoke in our room was really heavy when we got in, and that smell stayed with us for the rest of our stay. The gentleman from reception told us they can only ask people not to smoke and there is no rules to avoid them from this action! which was a bit surprising. Rooms were clean, but house keeping was not so organized. Our sheets were old enough and you could see a couple of failures in the bed sheets, but still clean. Rooms bigger than what we expected for a centrally located hotel. safe box in the room was big enough for what ever we had and you don't want to take with you in Amsterdam. Reception staff were extremely helpful, the only surprising point was the different opinions they had about the places one of them recommended to us and others didn't like it :-) Breakfast was good, and the breakfast area was quite big for all of hotel guests. Hotel has a parking which is a paid parking, which you should be expecting that. we didn't use the parking but saw a couple of guests using it and they didn't sound unsatisfied. Reception staff booked a taxi for us to the Schiphol airport with no headache and as they told us before, it was only needed 10 minutes to get the car. If you are number of people or have excess luggage, ask them to get a station for you, which need no extra charges. For the wing in which our rooms were in, there was only one elevator, and during peak hours, we needed to wait some time for the elevator to come. I think the size of elevator was also a bit smaller than what it should be. Apart from tired old sheets, and not so organized housekeeping, we really didn't have much to complain about. One note needed to be noted by families, is that the hotel is also close to the red light area, if you have any thoughts about that (avoiding or liking to be). I would like to stress again everything is very close to hotel (renting a bike, Maddam Tussauds, Dam square, central station, ...)

Reviews.Title: “Rho - oh, no!”
Reviews.Author: RobertPL
Reviews.Content: The best part was the front desk (lobby) and breakfasts! Nice hotel staff and quite a delicious food. Room we got was tiny, low ceiling, no air-condition. Windows have to be kept open and as a result many mosquitos appeared in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Walked from station, great location!”
Reviews.Author: luvtogo09
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were allowed to leave our bags. We loved the convenient location, walking everywhere in the city from there. Our room was quiet, well appointed and larger than we would have expected. The breakfasts (included( were wonderful. Easy to find with the large sign on top of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a city center”
Reviews.Author: Rasha971
Reviews.Content: It was lovely winter expirience. Hotel is in perfect area in a city center. The hotel building is redecorated theatre and it has a lot of character. Rooms were clean, comfortable and warm enough for the cold winter, equiped with TV and refrigirator. Bathroom was big and very functional. Restoraunt is placed near to the hotel lobby. The food for breakfast is great with a number of possibilities and different choices. The receptionists were very nice and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Phedges
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam quite a few times but first time at RHO. On edge of Dam Square it is a great location. 10-15 mins from central station. Found the staff very friendly and welcoming. For those not wanting to spend big money but not stay out in the sticks, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderfull breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LuisBrasil
Reviews.Content: Very well located. Kind staff. Clean room. Fair price. Bike rental available,

Reviews.Title: “foyer is the only impressive area”
Reviews.Author: pommycousin
Reviews.Content: well situated, reception staff always friendly and helpful, good buffet breakfast. Rooms were adequate but ordinary, only one rather slow lift. Foyer photo misleading as the rest of the hotel is very average

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: markismith50
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend spent two nights in this hotel on a city break holiday. The location is fantastic, being right on Dam Square and 5mins walk from the Central Train Station. Rooms were basic but clean, decent enough size, nice big bathroom. Breakfast buffet was very good, and reception staff helpful in letting us check in early and leave bags in locked store room after check-out. All in all, a good 3-star hotel for the price - made very good by the location.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ikkiLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel rather disappointing. It is true that its location is great and the staff were quite friendly. But the rooms were not extremely clean, and we did not like the fact that they wanted to have the car keys because they needed to move all the cars when one car wanted to leave. Of course we were happy to have found a hotel with a private garage, but this is not really what we expected!

Reviews.Title: “â€œCentrally Located with an Especially Great Staffâ€�”
Reviews.Author: AnthroLady
Reviews.Content: Ideal Location? Depends on your taste, how long youâ€™re staying, and what youâ€™re looking to do. The RHO Hotel is centrally locatedâ€”an easy walk with roller board suitcase from the main train station (which is a 15 minute train ride from the airport). Steps from Dam Square, the hotel provides easy access to the youth scene in the square, the â€œred lightâ€� district, lots of restaurants, and the museums. Since I was there for a conference, I was less interested in being close to the action (which can make the square a little congested and overwhelming and means lots of tourist groups checking in and out of the hotel in the summer) and more concerned about the distance from the University of Amsterdamâ€”just about 5 minutes away, a pleasant walk, down picturesque side streets, canals, and local cafes. The hotel was clean, updated, quiet, with great breakfast options, free wifi, friendly international guests, and a really, really, helpful staff. A little more expensive than my usual picks (especially with the dip in the dollar), the RHO turned out to be ideal for my visit because of the staff. They really made my stay worthwhile in every wayâ€”they were ready to answer any question, give directions, explain how to print from the computers in the business center late at night, tell me where to pay phone cards, and more.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, friendly, clean - just don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: IrishMaurice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location is perfect, in the heart of Amsterdam. We got breakfast which was so-so, but coffee and danish with real orange juice - that will do? Friendly slightly oddball staff, good fun and decent (not great) advice. Some negatives...the rooms are very basic. The bed is no too comfortable. But given the price and the location the positives outweigh the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: itsbetterinfiji
Reviews.Content: Rho hotel was great, not 5 star by any means but really friendly staff and well equipped rooms. Went there on my stag do and stayed in the apartments which are massive- far bigger than they look online. Breakfast is basic but perfect for starting the day with something substantial, they have toast, scrambled egg, a range of cold meats, bacon etc all in buffet style. Online photos don't really do the place justice, you will be pleasantly surprised. The best feature of this place is the location, right on dam square a stones throw from the action, but not so close that you never get any sleep or worry about having things stolen from your room. All in all very happy :)

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: ilyssion
Reviews.Content: Fab , stay about 3 times a year.The staff are just great and just like family.It is so central and close to the station.Really nice bars and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, value, central location, but no AC.”
Reviews.Author: KelioneLT
Reviews.Content: The old building at the front has reception and the breakfast room. Rooms are in a functional cubic accommodation block connected behind. Small room. The room was too warm, and had no AC. We put the fan in the window to draw in some air, but we had to close this at night to avoid the insects, for privacy, and to keep the room dark (it gets light quite early in an Amsterdam summer). Our room faced into the central courtyard, so it was quiet, but had no breeze, and allowed a full view into other guest rooms (and vice versa). Breakfast was extensive and ample. The staff at reception were very polite and helpful. We'll happily stay here again when the room is only required for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “My umpteenth stay at the lovely Rho Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Perpetuatraveller
Reviews.Content: When I say this was about my 20th stay, you'll gather that I am a VERY satisfied guest! The hotel is perfect. Central location - easy walking diance from the station. Comfortable quiet rooms. Great buffet breakfast. Excellent (free) wi-fi in the rooms and the foyer. Charming staff.Very clean. Good price. What more could anyone want?

Reviews.Title: “Remember to ask”
Reviews.Author: plantmanW_p_bch_Fl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for 2 nites prior to boarding a Baltic sea cruise, late June. The location was fine. The overall hotel was fine and the continental bkfst was excellent. The problem was that the rooms are not air conditioned. Now maybe they only get a handfull of days where you may need that, but we were there for one of them and the room was basicly an oven. Had to keep hallway door open to let cool air in or we would have died a slow death. If this is not an issue when you travel in summer and pay E 150 then you will be fine here. Just remember to ask if rooms have A/C.

Reviews.Title: “Correct, Ok rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Baraka72
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in June 2011. The room was ok, the bathroom a little ackward with the shower being the whole floor of the bathroom. The breakfast was complete but it was always crowded so you had to wait in line at the buffet for about 10 minutes. For the overall quality it may be overpriced, but you are paying for the great location right on Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and will be goin back”
Reviews.Author: sonnyisamackem
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights,rooms very clean,excellent location,good selection for breakfast and plenty tables,staff very helpful.rooms have free safety deposit box.safe room to leave luggage after you have checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Latch1975
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stag for 3 days in Amsterdam, the staff are so cool at this hotel they know how to help you if you get too high like one of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ShinBoy
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Amsterdam on business at the RAI centre but wanted a more central location that was well connected to public transport and reasonably priced, the RHO Hotel fitted the bill on all points. The location is fantastic, being just off Dam square so it is right in the heart of the city and walking distance to other, more sedate, areas. The room I had was on the very top floor which meant it had slanting ceilings but this just added character and the bed, shower, desk and storage were all adequate. Having a fridge in the room was a welcome edition too. The breakfast was very nice with plenty of choice and space to sit as this is quite a big hotel. The staff were also all very friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that I did not have a strong enough wifi connection in my room to use the internet so I had to go to the lobby whenever I wanted to go online. This was a bit of an inconvenience but as the lobby is spectacular (it is an old theatre) it was actually a pleasure to spend time there. I would certainly recommend the RHO for business and leisure stays.

Reviews.Title: “location location location and nice breakfest”
Reviews.Author: matyovis
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Very good location, at the corner of DAM square. The breakfest is fresh every day, clean and very nice. The rooms are not big but the bathroom was new and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again and again!”
Reviews.Author: skip1941
Reviews.Content: Very good to excellent hotel. Very clean and comfortable. Great location next to Dam Square and major tramway stop. Around the corner to the night life and resturants and a short walk to the redlight district. Anne Frank house is within walking distance as is major shopping. Great breakfast to suit European and USA tastes. Hotel personnel are very helpful and attentive but not pushy.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Moon66m
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, right at the edge of the red light district, and close to everything. Lovely clean and spacious room, clean beds and sparkling bathroom. Room faced onto the back, and was peaceful and quiet with no outside noise. Great breakfast buffet. Staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice room, excellent cleaning staff, excellent breakfast!.”
Reviews.Author: Neerol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rho for 6 nights. You can't beat the location. Right off of the National Monument tucked into an alley. Not too far to walk to tram stations. We had the opportunity to be there the day after the football team won the Dutch title, so lets just say it was a good thing we got to see the city before the fans arrived! Everyone is friendly and helpful to tourists. We were also there long enough to see most of the desk staff which is why I know understand why some reviewers said they were rude as well as friendly. I think it just depends on who is working that day. Our room was a nice size and the bed was extremely comfortable. Nice big shower as well. We stayed in room 306. It had a fridge and free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: kvc72
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to the Rho and I really can't fault it. The location couldn't be more central with everything right on your door step. The staff are always cheerful and helpful and are always willing to give advice and help. I've heard that some of the rooms are a strange shape and can be noisy but in my experience I have always had a spacious room with a nice bathroom. The only problem can be the heat at times. The rooms can sometimes become very hot and there is a lack of ventilation in the bedroom and especially the bathroom. The breakfast is very good with a good selection of hot and cold food and is available until 1030 which is great after a late night. The Rho doesn't offer you a canal view but for location, service, cleanliness and friendliness you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ChanelleL
Reviews.Content: We came to Amsterdam to check in to a hotel our friend was at and it was full. We aske the font desk if they could recommend any other hotel and they pointed us in the direction of the RHO Hotel. Let's just say we stayed here another night despite it being over our budget because were so comfortable. The staff was very accomidating and gave us a room with a view. The room was modern, simple and clean and actually pretty big for your average small European rooms. The beds were comfortable and the hotel has a lift. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and surpassed our expectations. It IS overlooking Dam Square so it is a bit noisy but it calms down after 1..... We slept fine. (my boyfriend and I usually stay up late and can sleep through noise so if you are sensitive to that it might bother you). Overall great place.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: bikeyspice
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stay in this hotel. The lobby is extremely spacious and grand which creates a good first impression. Reception staff were friendly and had a sense of humour which is always good. We checked in at about midday without any problems. We had requested a double bed and we were asked to confirm if this was still required when we checked in. Rooms were very clean and well presented but there were a couple of minor gripes though 1) No coffee facilities in room 2) I like a soft bed but the mattress was just a bit too soft meaning that you practically had to step up to get out of it in the morning! Would still prefer this to some of the rock hard mattresses I've experienced elsewhere though The room had a good sized fridge and safe which were very welcome. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice of fruit, eggs, bacon, cereals etc. So much better than the crusty roll in a basket offered by some hotels Location was perfect, right off Dam square and was easy to find and just a 10 minute walk from Centraal Station I would go back in an instant and wouldn't even consider choosing a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cottagegirl25
Reviews.Content: Located just off Dam Square within easy walking distance to the Red Light District, Anne Frank House and Old Church, the RHO Hotel offers a clean, quiet three-star type room and excellent hot and cold buffet style breakfast. Our only complaint was the room was very warm and the small fan did not provide sufficient air circulation.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby! Ideal location, hard to fault.”
Reviews.Author: chairman_jell
Reviews.Content: First impression is the hotel lobby/foyer which is a visual treat. Helpful reception, both with checking in and local information. Booked a triple room, a sort of L shaped room with the 3rd bed at the end of the L - ideal when travelling with a teenager. Simple but spotlessly clean and plenty spacious. Big bathroom. Only niggles were that room got quite warm on first night and we could not work out how to adjust heating, also sound of footsteps from corridors overhead from time to time. Lift could mean a bit of a wait and stairs are steep and not easy unless you are able bodied. First floor has seating overlooking that magnificent lobby. Small bar which we did not try out. Breakfast buffet is very good - even had a rice dish which suited my wife who is Coeliac (no gluten). Location perfect. Edge of red light area. Just off Dam Square. Two blocks from main tramlines and 10 minutes walk from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: theliles
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews, I had mixed emotions about staying there. When we arrived, we were greeted by a very friendly staff and given our 3 rooms right away. Our rooms were very clean and suitable for our stay. The bathroom was sparkling clean. The location was convenient to transportation and many restaurants were within easy walking distance. We would stay there again with confidence. Also the breakfast served from 7 - 10am was another surprise. While it was busy at 9AM, everything was available and foods replaced as needed. They served hot and cold items geared to American and European tastes and much better than some in 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel service ever”
Reviews.Author: Tourist_from_Denmark
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at around 21:15, the hotel told me that they had cancelled my reservation for no good reason. The staff was also very unfriendly. I ended up staying at the hotel anyway, because I did not what to run around looking for a new hotel at that time. It did, however, cost me an extra 110 â‚¬ compared to by original booking, and I had to change room after the first night. The 2nd room I got had not been cleaned and the mini-fridge did also not work. The only good thing about this hotel is the location and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service, Rooms Just Average”
Reviews.Author: SoxFans07
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based upon both location and fair price. The hotel is central and we were able to walk to everything. We entering the hotel, we noticed the lobby was a little dated, but was clean and the staff was very friendly, despite the fact that the desk was mobbed. We were asked what type of bed we would like, which I appreciated. When we made our way to the room, we began to get a little nervous, as the age of the hotel and decor continued to appear a little worn. The room was decent size for Europe, we received a double bed, but the bath was only a shower, no curtain just a stall. Although again....it was very clean and the $ was right. Only complaint , it was VERY loud at night. Our room faced another building with a small alley in between...the restaurant on the end of the alley decided to use this alley for their dining room, so there were tables set up and was quite loud when the groups came in for a late night snack. The breakfast was very good compared to the standard EU bread and cheese, there were hot selections, cereals, etc. We did have to wait one morning because it was full, but wait was 5 minutes, so no big deal. Would likely stay here again because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Amsterdam, but cheap rooms”
Reviews.Author: TandCfromHawaii
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of Amsterdam...so please be ready to hear the sounds of the city at all hours of the day and night! The hotel is right around the corner from The Dam and within 2 blocks of the Red Light district, several major shopping streets, and the tram lines. We walked about 10 mins from the Centraal Station to get to the RHO. There are no canal boats that pass near there. The hotel itself seems nice until you get up into the rooms. Despite elevators, we still needed to carry our suitcases up several short stairs, seemingly randomly placed. The room was VERY small. We were given the option of 1 big bed or two twins. I (mistakenly?) asked for the 1 "big" bed and was given a room with a very small double bed. There wasn't much space in the room, and we had to use the bed to access our suitcase. There was a flat screen TV in the room, with 1 english station (CNN Europe). Breakfast was included in the price but we had to wait in line one day because of the crowd. The room is large, but they have a LOT of guests! Breakfast included scrambled and hard boiled eggs, bacon, sliced meats and cheeses, yogurt, cereals, breads, pancakes (real cakes, not light fluffy ones we expect in the states), pastries, orange juice, coffee and teas. The staff spoke very good english and was very helpful. The keys are unique and should be turned in before you leave the hotel. If you lose the key, it can easily be traced back to your room, which isn't safe. The bathroom was small, but adequate. The towels were thin, but the worst part was the lack of water pressure (we were only on the 2nd floor) and the fact that the water temperature kept fluctuating between freezing and scalding with no rhyme or reason. The bed, as I said before, was small, but generally comfortable. There was 1 extra pillow (for a total of 3) which were not that comfortable at all. I did not sleep well because of the street noise (people yelling and carrying on well into the wee hours of the night despite it being Tues-Thurs) as well as the street cleaners and garbage trucks.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at the Rho.”
Reviews.Author: owl2
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the Rho hotel on my first visit to Amsterdam 5 years ago, and having just returned from my second visit I have once again not been disappointed. The only real improvement would be in the provision of tea and coffee in the rooms, but everything else was really good. Our room size was good, the bathroom was very spacious with a massive bath and lovely hot shower, and the beds are comfortable. There is also a good area for storing suitcases. We didn't hear any noise from the corridors and there was no smell of cigarette smoke. I was surprised by the reviewer who thought the breakfast set-up was disorganised, as I don't know how it could have been any more organised; the wide range of options are extremely clearly laid out, and bacon and eggs are regularly replenished by the numerous breakfast staff. The staff were very attentive, clearing tables as soon as people left the room. They even came around to offer refills of coffee. The location of the hotel is excellent. We used the Connexxion hotel shuttle bus, which takes you door to door, but if you were to take the train from the airport the walk from the station to the hotel is only approx 10 minutes, along one main road, so very easy to find the hotel. The staff are efficient, and there's no problem leaving your bags after check out as there is a luggage room. One restaurant recommendation : Luden brasserie on Spuistraat.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine review ....good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MrT98
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in March 2011. We found the hotel to be in a prime location and the room we had which was a double bedded room was clean ,tidy and with no problems. The only thing is it has no tea making facilities but otheriwse it was good.A bit noisy at night but thats Amsterdam. The staff where ok at reception some a bit offish but no problem.
