The problem which is only minor was the breakfast which could definetely be improved.Sometimes there was no scrambled egg and it was badly organised. apart from that I would go back tomorrow. If you go you will enjoy your stay its right on the doorstep of all the action. Happy holidays.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: flipper42
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 night only (shame it was'nt for longer),as this is a very friendly and very well located hotel . The rho is easy to find, just beside madam tussauds over the road.on entering the hotel before i even said hello the gent behind the desk said "hello you must be mr... and knew who we were and welcomed us warmly.we were politely informed that our room wasn't ready but could leave our luggage till later' which we did. came back to hotel after 1 30 p.m to find our room was ready.As there were three of us we were allocated a triple room on the 2nd floor. the room was very spacious, clean warm and bright. The beds were comfortable and the room was on the side street so was very quiet and made for a great nights sleep!. breakfast was a delight, lovely crispy bacon scambled egg etc ham, cheeses, fresh uncut breads(3 or 4 different kinds), cereals, fruit tea & coffee(lovely stong coffee) andthe best thing for me was the freshly squeezed orange juice- yes it really was PROPER juice, best i've ever had in any hotel EVER!! The breakfast room is spacious clean and bright and the staff are friendly and efficient. The rho is very central right on dam square next to shops, trams, red light district, restaurants,etc. when visiting amsterdam next time i would definitely choose this hotel again,no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SissyBar
Reviews.Content: Located near Dam Square, RHO Hotel is very well situated; e.g. walking distance from railway station, close to all tram lines. There are hundreds of restaurants etc. in the vicinity. Single room was small but clean. Bathroom was rather big and also clean. The room was very hot when I entered - luckily the heating radiator could be tunred off. The downside was that it could only be either on (=hot) or off. There was a safe in the room but no key to it. Key couldn't be found at the reception either but there was a safe I could use for free. Staff was always happy to help. Wi-fi was free and worked very well. There are also two computers, one with a printer, in the lobby. Breakfast room was spacious and the selction of food was versatile from pancakes to fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Good apart from knackered taps, lumpy pillows and no drawers!”
Reviews.Author: StegSomerset
Reviews.Content: Delightful former-theatre conversion, superbly placed off Dam Square, our well-insulated room was on 3rd floor facing quiet side street. Staff very friendly and helpful. Pleasant buffet breakfast, same stuff every day. Clean and spacious room but old taps made it very difficult to control temperature for basin and shower. For safety reasons, respectable hotel showers should all be thermostatically controlled these days. The towels were thin, the pillows were poor quality filled with foam chips and the drawer unit in the room had been replaced by a fridge. Had to keep all non-hangable things in our suitcase. Would have been plenty of room for a drawer unit. Hoped for better value in these respects at Â£100 per night. Recommended because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: LadyAshley86
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, with a central location in Amsterdam. Right next to everything and a great base for exploring. However... our room was roasting hot (even in December), opened the windows during the night but its REALLY noisy. Bathroom is one of the wet room styles, which I personally do not like. Our friends had a room for the same rate which was easily 1.5 times the size of ours. Corridors reek of smoke also. I think it is a bit expensive for the standard offered, but the location is great, and we did stay at new year so maybe more expensive than usual. I would liken the hotel to a sub standard travel lodge (being kind). I would still recommend for the location only.

Reviews.Title: “Good, reasonably priced hotel in the heart of old Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: alainec
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rho is perfrectly situated in the heart of old Amsterdam. My room, though a bit updated was very large as well as the bathroom. I would definitely go there again

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiamaria77
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were more than surprised at the location of the hotel. Reception were very polite and kind. Me and my partner found it very funny as it seemed that they were almost, well, "Spaced out!" In the morning we went to breakfast which stops at 10.30- even if you get down there for 10.20 you are still guaranteed something as everything is replenished. The food is amazing, I think that's what's really the encouragement to go back. The rooms are very basic so of your picky it's not for you. There is a bit of noise in the corridors but that's usual in any hotel. We liked this hotel so much that we're planning to go back at some point in the new year. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TonyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: RHO Hotel is centrally situated for all attractions and is less than 10 minutes walk from Central Station. From the minute you walk into the massive, stylish lobby you know you have arrived at a quality hotel. Staff were most helpful - we were allowed to check in early (it was sub-zero outside) and our bags were stored for us after checkout. We had a spacious, bright and airy triple room with excellent en-suite bathroom - very quiet as the hotel is away from the main square. Breakfast was excellent with a wide range of hot/cold food. I doubt if you could beat the RHO for value in central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location right by Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: tap6699
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rho for one night on a DFDS minicruise. The location can't be beat just off Dam Square in a side road very near to the Krasnapolsky. Our room was a good size and had a large bathroom with walk in shower (no bath). Large room safe which is useful for laptops. Breakfast was included and had a good selection of cereals, breads, cold meats and some hot items. Staff were very friendly and there is a large luggage room to store your bags after check out. Great hotel for the price and great location for us as it is central and close to our favourite restaurants and bars in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: pascaldominique
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very helpful and sympathetic, terrific location downtown and good healthy breakfast items; but noisy breakfast hall and poor lightings

Reviews.Title: “Very good value... excellent loication”
Reviews.Author: lelo100
Reviews.Content: Great spot... close to all the signts. Very clean and lovely breakfast. I'd reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Always soooooo happy to be back at the Rho Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Perpetuatraveller
Reviews.Content: I've lost count of how many times I've stayed at this very central Hotel. Returning this weekend and being greeted at check in with "Welcome home!" was so lovely. The Hotel is ultra clean, and very comfortable. Despite Amsterdam being 'party central', I had undisturbed nights. Breakfast - buffet style - is fab. The location of the Hotel is perfect for public transportation and for exploring this lovely city on foot. I have stayed at other hotels in Amsterdam, including one which is much, much more expensive - but simply wouldn't think of being anywhere other than the Rho for all future visits. Lighting-speed free wi fi access in the rooms and the stunning foyer is a bonus. Two thumbs up, high in the air!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Rho”
Reviews.Author: daveevee
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to Amsterdam for her fortieth without the babies :-). Excellent location just off Dam Square but down a side road so very little noise. 3 stars = good size room for Amsterdam with accomodation of Travelodge standards in the Uk plus a cracking breakfast included in a very competitive price.Staff were courteous and helpful only thing that would help is tea and coffee in rooms but having a fridge in the room was very useful. If you are after good value accomodation in a excellent location give the Rho a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: macgray
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights which I booked through the hotel website at hoteliers.com. As stated, the hotel is a short walk from the train station, down to Dam Square and then in a side street off it. I was asked if I wanted a quiet room and as requested we were given a large room on the top floor towards the back. The room was clean, toiletries provided, with plain decor. There was a tv and in room safe and fridge. The bathroom was clean and had a shower over the bath. Although it was October, the room was warm and comfortable. Breakfast next morning was more than adequate, self service, with a small selection of hot food as well as cold meats, cheeses, yogurt, fruit, cereal and pastries. Staff at reception were excellent, with good suggestions for nearby restaurants and activities. The location was very near to the tram lines and to canal cruise boats, as well as at the top of the Red Light district - not as seedy as it sounds, we always felt very safe along the main street of it and in fact, ate in a restaurant along there one evening. For a short stay, this really was a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Jaimumbai
Reviews.Content: great location - bars; coffee shops, restaurants all around......great staff - no issues during check-in and check-out ...friendly staff who always were more than happy to help you as to how you could reach a certain location... you can hire cycles from the hotel itself...the breakfast is good...but repetitive (i think all the 3 days we had exactly the same menu)... small rooms but had all the basic necessaties...perfect value for money hotel (please note that its not a plush or a swanky hotel - its a basic hotel - you pay more for the location and a good hotel specially if you dont intend to spend too much time in the room)...

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: PandMtravel
Reviews.Content: The room we had was pretty standard. It was quiet, relatively roomy with basic furniture. Very good location in the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “It served it's purpose well.”
Reviews.Author: sebbs
Reviews.Content: Over in Amsterdam on a two day jolly, so I chose The Rho hotel for it's location. Reading some of the previous reviews I guess some people are a bit pernickety. Checked in by a courteous Algerian gentleman, no problems, room 433 very clean and extremely comfortable bed, ideal for one person. Did not see any mice and the water was hot, previous comments. Reception staff very knowledgeable on buses, trams and trains. In fact on my way out in the evening, as it was raining, I was offered a brolly, but turned it down because of the wind. The breakfast was better than some of the five star hotels that I have stayed in, on business,excellent value. If I had to make any negatives, then being typically English, tea/coffee facilities in the room would have been nice. Secondly, as with many hotels, there seemed to be a lack of security. Anyone can walk in off the street and have breakfast as no checks are made for name or room number. Would I stay in the Rho hotel again? yes.

Reviews.Title: “location. location. location”
Reviews.Author: JessiKA16
Reviews.Content: great location between all amsterdam attractions, near damrak sq and central station. the hotel is equipped with large elevators which is a big plus, the breakfast buffet is tasty but you have to hurry up because its until 11.00AM. The rooms are clean so overall the hotel is great for its money value. i would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMikeB
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy room, but excellent location to walk to everything. Also good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “City centre location, excellent value and everything you need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: CityBreaker50
Reviews.Content: Nothing but good things to say about the Rho. Fantastic location seconds off Dam Square, a short stroll from the Centraal Station. Despite being right in the middle of the city, we had the best 3 nights sleep ever in a bed away from home. The room was amazingly quiet and the bed really comfortable. The room fridge was available to us to chill our own drinks, and the room safe was free. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. Everything seemed new, clean and fresh - duvets, pillows, shower curtain - and our towels were changed daily. Breakfast was something else (the staff endlessly replenish the buffet with fresh hot and cold items and clean crockery/cutlery) and really set us up for the days spent discovering the many attractions of Amsterdam. All the hotel staff are extremely efficient and very helpful - we were even invited to use the free computers in reception to check in our return flights and print our boarding cards. We visited on a BA City Break and got an amazing flight + hotel deal. Schipol airport to Amsterdam is 20 minutes by train and there is a train every 10 to 15 minutes, both into and out of the city. Best places to eat are out of the immediate vicinity of the centre/Dam Square. Try Utrechtestraat where there are some lovely small restaurants with delicious fixed price 3-course menus at around 20-25 euros. Wouldn't hesitate to return and would definitely stay at the Rho again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dixiedoug
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Iâ€™ve stayed at the RHO Hotel several times and like it better than anywhere else Iâ€™ve stayed in Amsterdam. It ainâ€™t the Ritz, so donâ€™t bother if thatâ€™s what you want. The RHO is at the heartbeat of Amsterdam and is a great place to stay for visiting all the great places the city has to offer. Itâ€™s a huge bargain if only because of the location. However, add all the other things the RHO provides and itâ€™s very difficult to beat, for the price. They have a spacious comfortable lobby, helpful and courteous staff, bar, wonderful breakfast with hot food and cold food, clean rooms, wifi, in-room safe, and windows that open. If you want a beer and the barâ€™s closed, you can buy one in the vending machine! Iâ€™ve always had a very comfortable bed and enjoyed a sound nightâ€™s sleep while staying there. There are so many great places to visit within easy walking distance! The Albert Heijn grocery market is just a short walk away. Whatever you interests, theyâ€™re easily visited from this location. Amsterdamâ€™s public transportation is really good, so itâ€™s easy to get around. I walk from Central Station to the RHO. Once I had a taxi take me because a wheel broke off my suitcase. The taxi driver said, â€œBut sir, the RHO Hotel is just a few blocks away.â€� After I showed him my suitcase was missing a wheel he understood. I recommend the RHO Hotel to anyone I know visiting Amsterdam. Iâ€™ll be staying there again in a couple of months. I took advantage of their 10% discount for booking online on their website 2 months in advance. Iâ€™m counting the days!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: EastlandMall
Reviews.Content: Pros: good breakfast, staff friendly, wifi access (strange 6 hour password system....), close to Central Station, view of Dam Square from breakfast area Cons: small rooms, worn, tiny towels, little dirty. Motel 6 furnishings. Very basic for a 3-star and for this price. Will try someplace else for this $$$ next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Damsquare
Reviews.Content: Arrived while world cup final was being played, stopped for one night, bedroom was large,very clean, and the staff couldnt do enough for us. Good location on the corner of Dam Square,will definatley stay again,Breakfast served till late morning and was very good.

Reviews.Title: “central but overpriced three star off the Dam”
Reviews.Author: beatrishelder
Reviews.Content: The only advantage of the Rho hotel is its location, right behind the Dam square. However, rooms were small, basic close to shabby, noisy and without air conditioning. At the reception you are asked to PAY IN ADVANCE for the rooms, which is definitely not a consumer oriented policy. Hotel parking, if available, is expensive (some 38 euros) and close public parking is about 50 euros. For sure there are better deals in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service, never again”
Reviews.Author: silvercat34
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, just in front of Dam Square, minutes from Central Station. We booked a triple room, and the room was sufficient for the 3 of us. The bed was comfortable. But there was no AC, just a fan. Since we arrived at night and it was cold, it was not a problem to us. However, the shower didn't work. There were 2 taps, one for hot and one for cold, and the cold one didn't work at all. We found out about this late at night so we didn't bother asking the staff to fix it. In the morning we had to leave early for our flight, so we ended up not taking a shower because of this. For the rate we paid, we expected more of this hotel. We paid for this hotel when we checked-in, which was weird for us, most hotels ask for payments during check-out, but not this one. Anyway, it was not a big problem we just found it weird, like they didn't trust us or something. The staff...well...they were rude, unfriendly, stuck up, and had the air like they were better than us. When we checked-in, I asked my mother to check-in for us and for some reason, the guy at the reception couldn't find our booking. I told him again that we booked under my mother's name, and he finally found our booking and then told my mother that "You could've told me your name"...like she was annoying him, how rude. The next day after we checked-out we had to leave soon to catch our flight so we asked the receptionist to call a taxi for us. She did and asked us to stay in the lobby and wait for the taxi. About 15 minutes later my mother went out and saw a taxi near the front door of the hotel and thought it was our taxi. So we immediately got out, brought our luggages, and thanked the receptionist. When we got out, the receptionist caught up to us and asked us not to get to into the taxi because it was not the one she called for. And she very rudely told us "You can't ask me to call a taxi for you and then you get in another taxi!" and she stormed off inside. I was baffled and outraged. How were we supposed to know that it was not our taxi?! She didn't explain anything! Anyway, we ended up not getting into the taxi and I went back in to ask her what was the name of the taxi she called for. She didn't tell me the name of the taxi just that usually the taxi driver of the taxi they called for would get into the hotel and let the receptionist know that they've arrived. If we get into a taxi she didn't call for, we could get charged double (which I doubt because we have been in Amsterdam several times and this never happened). And she very rudely said that she didn't care what taxi we got into, that she only did that for us. Well, she could've told us nicely and not rudely like that. I mean she's a receptionist, working in hospitality industry, and should be friendly to their guests at all times! Anyway, around 5 minutes later the correct taxi arrived. Because of this very rude receptionist, I will never ever go back to this hotel despite the great location. The rate isn't great either. Expensive for what we got...broken shower and rude staff. Thank God we only stayed one night...definitely don't stay at this hotel if you don't want to meet rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: educator_bhoy
Reviews.Content: I booked this whole on some advice from a friend for 5 nights in late June and it was great. Wonderful location literally minutes from Central Station, a few metres away from Dam Square. I booked a single and I knew what to expect a small room but by Amsterdam standards it was very good, the staff was wonderful and always helpful, breakfast was included and was plentiful,the only downside was the wifi which required a password and didnt always work with my Iphone, but there are 2 computers on the ground level available for guests to use. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthChrisP
Reviews.Content: Everything was great and location was fun as the hotel was so close to the interesting districts.Staff were great and breakfast plentiful.The beds were comfortable and a fridge for our own drinks. There is a bar downstairs but the barman was not around when we wanted a drink.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Matt640ktm
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a fantastic position.Right on the doorstep of Dam Square,10 min walk from the trainstation.Easy walking distance to the whole city.Rooms very clean and beds where very comfortable.We had a triple room,which had a double bed and a single bed that was seperated by the bathroom,so at least you could have a bit of privacy.Flatscreen tv,fridge and also a safe that you did not have to leave a deposit for which was a bonus in everyway.The Reception desk where very helpful.We arrived at around 10.30am and our room was ready so they let us have it straight away.There are also some vending machines for cold drinks and chocolate.The decor/entrance of the hotel is beautiful.Very art decor.The breakfast buffet was spot on too.You could choose cornflakes to cakes to bacon and scrambled eggs and everything in-between.I would highly recommend this hotel and i will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “One place to stay to enjoy life in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: KDee_0212
Reviews.Content: It would be wrong to say that it is located in the centre of the city. It is actually centre of the city. We stayed for ONE night at the hotel. it is located just next to whatever you want in Amsterdam, the main districts, the shopping street, Madame Tussads, railway Station and the boat cruises. One just have to move a few steps and you are there. If you want to move to a bit distance place then the tram station is just about across the street. Also, prices offered was value for money considering the busy weekend coinciding witht he last week of the Tulip Festival in Keukenhoff. Also, the staff was helpful in guiding the locations and places to see within and around Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the best staff you will ever meet... small rooms and not massively comfy.”
Reviews.Author: Itstime222
Reviews.Content: If you need just a bed or you want possibly the best staff in Europe, go to the Rho. If you want luxury, dont bother.

Reviews.Title: “if you need internet...DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: i was so disappointed in my stay here - especially after reading all the great reviews. the hotel is very clean & in an awesome location. but the advertised free wifi in every room DOES NOT WORK AT ALL. i was in a room that got no signal whatsoever & asked to change. so i changed rooms closer to the lobby, and then had internet for a few hours and then never again for the rest of my stay. even when you do have a signal, they have this horrifying system of obtaining 6 hour vouchers from the front desk - with a login system that gives you errors, times out, tells you you are already logged in....it's an absolute nightmare. the staff is unfriendly & unhelpful - no one was concerned at all with my needs, they just want to get you off the phone or away from the desk. unless you want to spend the whole time in the lobby or roaming the hallways trying to get wifi...stay somewhere else. besides that the rooms were cramped and oddly designed (for example in one of the rooms i had, the shower drain was under the bathroom sink counter....you had to move all your things off the counter to take a shower, as it basically flooded the floor and the counter...strange.) and if it's hot...the rooms are VERY hot even in mild weather. no ventilation or A/C. just a fan on the desk. my window was broken and hanging off the hinge. also, no do not disturb signs if you are like me and prefer not to have housekeeping enter your room every day while you are out. for 100 euros per night, i expect more. i will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: igan
Reviews.Content: We spend a three nights at Rho and i'm very pleased with my choice.The staff were very helpful and polite and met all our wishes. Perfect location with easy access to all in the town.Rooms are spacious and clean with comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly helpful hospitable staff, just steps from Dam Square.”
Reviews.Author: Dcraigclark
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Rho so we knew it was convenient and friendly, with lots of character. But when we arrived to find the road blocked with city workers, the front desk guy who was going off duty got into our car and helped find a back way to the Rho's garage, giving a native's take on the people and places on the way. Traveling with a teenage boy, it was also nice to have true triple accomodations, not a pullout couch or rollaway. We love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location For All Amsterdam Has To Offer”
Reviews.Author: capguncraig
Reviews.Content: The Rho hotel is located about as central as you need to be in Amsterdam, The hotel is situated on Nes a stones throw from Dam square, in fact i could actually see the famous Dam square monument from my room window. I booked a single room through the hotel website without any problems. And arrived 4 hours before my 2pm check in and they had my room ready for me. This was a big bonus and the staff were very good. The room was clean and comfortable with a decent shower and bathroom, Flat screen TV,Mini fridge (no Mini Bar) And a free and easy to use safe. The foyer area was very impressive large and spacious with a drinks and snack vending machine with everything from Heineken to water in it. Also there is a hot drinks machine for coffees etc situated next to it. There is also a small bar located to the left of the main check in desk but i never saw anyone having a drink in it or anyone actually working behind it all weekend. No great problem as there are plenty to choose from soon as you walk outside the hotel. The breakfast buffet was fine with bacon and scrambled eggs as well as the usual continental choices to pick from with fresh juices and tea and coffee available. (Impressive by Amsterdam standards!) In summary i would not hesitate to stay at the Rho Again. The location is the biggest plus this hotel has. It is a 3 star and from experience i would say is a fair assessment for a city based hotel in Europe. I have stayed in 4 & 5 star hotels in Amsterdam and felt let down but cant find any fault with the Rho. It is slightly dated in the corridor areas and there was a little noise from the street below but these things personally were not a problem to me and wouldnt stop me staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab on all fronts”
Reviews.Author: chezndave
Reviews.Content: Location is fab, room so warm we had to open the windows, breakfast was soooo fab, would go back or recomend

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel on dam square”
Reviews.Author: timdoncolby
Reviews.Content: the rho hotel is on the corner of dam square which is 10 minutes from central station and 2 minutes from the coffee shops and fun part of amsterdam the hotel has a beautiful entrance area. the rooms are good and the breakfast is good. this hotel is in the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam without the Tulips”
Reviews.Author: Cheltenhamspa
Reviews.Content: The Rho Hotel is situated just off Dam Square. A perfect location for all bars & restaurants and close to the main attractions. The railway is only 20mins walk away so not very far to take your luggage. The Hotel itself is clean and quiet with free WI-FI access and a good if basic breakfast included in the price. All in all a good hotel and would use again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lindz-M
Reviews.Content: stayed here over new years eve...so OBVIOUSLY it was noisy....hotel staff was very helpful with anything we needed, included breakfast was very good, room service did a good job...not perfect but good...but after long days of walking around and eating and drinking too much it was the perfect place to rest your head!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Edzco
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short break in Amsterdam and stayed at the RHO Hotel. I looked at a lot of reviews, on trip advisor,before booking and was a bit apprehensive about some of the comments. I shouldn't have been, as it is a very good hotel. The previous writer summed it up really well.Take the train from Schipol airport as it's cheaper than a taxi. The RHO is walking distance from Central station. The RHO is just off Dam square (a few paces and you are there). Since it's central it makes it a good base for visiting all the sights. We walked to Van Gogh museum which is a fair distance, but we both like walking. The cafes on the square are excellent for people watching and we would unwind with a coffee/beer at the end of the day.( Back to the hotel) We received a warm welcome from the desk clerk and we had stipulated an upper floor room which we received. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. No noise was heard from outside, and the only noise inside was the odd guest who seemed unable to close their door without banging it? A minor gripe! The room was average sized and we had a bath and shower.The bathroom has a hairdryer and the room comes with a safe for you personal belongings. A buffet breakfast is served and the food was excellent. Staff kept the buffet well stocked up and used plates were cleared away promptly. We wandered around at night and never felt threatened but a bit of common sense is required at all times. The Euro isn't doing too well so it did seem a bit expensive, but that's life! The hop on/hop off bus was good value at 10 euros each for a 24hour pass. When it was time to leave the RHO staff helped us print off our boarding passes and offered to look after our bags until the time of our flight. We were not disappointed at booking this hotel. Definitely worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “RHO was great”
Reviews.Author: sunnyokgirl
Reviews.Content: Booked the RHO online a year before traveling and glad we did, as the prices had increased by this year. We paid cash in Euro's and received a 10% discount. The RHO was our starting point for a 15 day river cruise - Amsterdam to Budapest.This hotel rated as a 3-star was much more to us. The staff was very friendly, the breakfast buffet was more that enough, the room very clean and the location 1 min. off Dam Square was ideal. We are going back next Sept. and will not hesitate to book the RHO again. Amsterdam was a wonderful city and we look forward to returning. Try to take in the free city tour starting at 11:15 at the monument at Dam Square. The three pubs on Dam Square made for great people watching and so close back to the RHO!.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: theselkie
Reviews.Content: After we booked this hotel we were a bit worried by some of the reviews we then read on this site, however we were more than happy with everything at the Rho hotel. It was spotlessly clean, the beds were very comfortable although my friend found hers a bit soft for her liking. We were there from Thursday until Monday and had fresh towels every day and our beds changed on the Sunday. Breakfast was varied and filling, service was courteous and super fast. During our trip there was a fair in Dam Square with big wheel, chair-o-planes and lots of food stalls etc., however once in the hotel we heard nothing of the noise outside. There are a couple of things that would have made the hotel even better. A kettle in the rooms would have been really welcome (although it says you can get hot drinks by asking at reception, it wasn't that easy and we ended up with a pot of hot water but no tea bags or cups and one rather confused/bemused night receptionist!), and better lighting in the room. The sockets are part of the main lighting circuit so when you put the lights off, the sockets go off too! However the sockets by the tv and fridge are independent and there was a spare for our phone chargers etc. There were NO MICE, although, like every house, restaurant and hotel in Amsterdam there was a resident cat. Come on, the place is full of 15thc. buildings and canals, what do you expect? We will definitely use the Rho again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Cosielou
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a superb location.It was clean & I saw NO MICE,despite what it says on one of the reviews.The staff were more then helpful and allowed us to check into the hotel at 10.30 am when we arrived.Also when we were checking out we were able to leave the bags in the hotel and collect them later. Breakfast was fantastic, there was a huge choice from cold food right through to cooked breakfast.We were well set up for the day. Room was basic but very clean and comfortable.Overall I would highly reccommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, quite adequate accomodation, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: DavidLancy
Reviews.Content: Like any major city, hotels in Amsterdam seem pricey by US standards (NYC excepted). So the Rho, which we found via rigorous internet search seemed "reasonable," We spent 6 nights at the facility and we're very pleased. The facility is clean, the rooms were a good size and the breakfast was varied, extensive and tasty. The staff were extremely helpful and we made heavy use of their knowledge of the city. The hotel is 10" from the train station and even closer to subway and tram stops. The transportation system in the Netherlands is superb, even for non-bicyclists.There are numerous restaurants around the Rho ranging in price and focus.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: Yatzpan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its central location and the mini-fridge in every room. We were pretty much disappointed with everything after we left as we felt it could have been done better. The location is as good as it can get, right on the Dam square but in a tiny side street so there is very little street noise. However this means that it is very hard to get by car to the front of the hotel, not even the taxi could do it. The reception service was good, we got our keys right away and used the elevator to get to the first floor, only to discover that it has three levels which could pose a problem for disabled people, or when carrying heavy luggage. One level has stairs, and the other has a ramp that is pretty dangerous to walk on. The rooms are of decent size, but the sound proofing is horrible. The floor is wooden under the carpet and every step makes the entire room shake. The walls are paper thin and you will hear every step your neighbors take. The bathroom has no air ventilation and this was pretty horrible. They don't even put an air freshener in there. You are forced to open the room windows every time someone visits the bathroom and with the cold October air this was not a pleasant experience. The main light switch controls the electricity running the two bedside lamps which means you cannot have one open without opening the main light. You can't even use the socket to charge your electronic devices at night (there are no free sockets, just the TV and the fridge's) The breakfast was pretty good, good variety and service. A thing we found to be pretty unsafe, the signs leading to the emergency staircase point to the wrong door. At least two signs we saw on our floor. Overall we would not recommend this hotel to anyone that is sensitive to noise or smell.

Reviews.Title: “very understanding staff that do all to help.”
Reviews.Author: fraser_a3
Reviews.Content: Rooms fantasic, great location, clean, helpful, wonderful breakfast, honest, helpful, considerate staff, just a wonderful stay, cant fault the place have stayed twice and will not be staying anywhere else from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nice staff and has parking but...”
Reviews.Author: toots347
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. The staff were excellent and very helpful, the room was clean and functional and we made use of their garage which is a rare thing in Amsterdam. We enjoyed our breakfast in the morning, but there were a couple of things that annoyed us. The room had a damp stain on the ceiling and it would seem that there is not much soundproofing between rooms. We had a room above us that appeared to have a guest who had to get out of bed every few minutes, stomp around and then seemed to move the furniture about!! Not the fault of the Hotel but annoying to a customer. The lift which was quite close to us was fairly noisy as well.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandGalaxy
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam with my husband and parents, and we stayed at the Rho Hotel. The staff were wonderful, the rooms were clean, large and very comfortable, the breakfast was excellent. Just off Dam Square, so very central for reaching the central sites. A very enjoyable stay. I must say again ..... the staff at the hotel were excellent and couldn't do enough to ensure our comfort. Thank you for a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: spikeymires
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel. Ideal for weekend breaks. Just off Dam Square so location is pretty much perfect, only 10 mins walk from the main train station. Rooms were quite small but clean and comfortable. Breakfast was worth getting up for. This place does seem to be popular with stags/hens etc so it might get a bit lively at times. The Scottish football fans had taken over the city when we were there but all seemed to be in good spirits. Good value city centre hotel

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: W29FB
Reviews.Content: I travelled with five friends to this location,when we arrived we were checked in very quickly which was great.the rooms were very clean and fresh.After unpacking we headed out to see the sights,the hotel is just seconds away from Dam Square.Hotel staff were very friendly and extremely helpful.Breakfast was great as they continue to serve until 10.30.As my friends and I were only booked in for B+B we were told that if we wanted we could bring food in and take it to our rooms.Overall an excellent hotel to stay in and I look forward to staying in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Moosinator
Reviews.Content: RHO hotel was very conveniently located. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. This is not a luxury hotel. But we felt it was perfect for Amsterdam. Although it was located on Dam Square, it was really not that noisy. The breakfasts were very pleasing. We would definately go back. We also had a tub which was great. No air conditioning for us spoiled Americans, but the small fan we had did the job. If you want a four star hotel, go elsewhere. If you want a good, solid, old hotel in the heart of the city, stay at RHO. They also offer parking if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “The mice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmrs35
Reviews.Content: no there is no mistake in my title, it really does say the mice hotel and not the nice hotel!! my husband and I had the misfortune of staying in room 308 at this hotel, the room had large windows with a balcony outside, other guest in rooms along side could of walked passed our window, so was very security aware. on our first night I was woken by noises in our room, but on checking everything was assured that all was well. on our last night, after a fantastic night out I was again woken by the same noise, to my astonishment I saw mice all over my room, not a mouse but mice!! several in fact. I was so destressed, my husband said I must of imagined it, so I sat with the light on with my camera and finally got a picture of it, my husband couldnt believe the size of one of them. after complaining to the night staff we moved room at 5am, they did not apologise in fact I got the impression it was a common factor with this hotel. was even told it was my fault as I may have food in my room!! so be warned, you will not be the only visitor in your hotel room, good luck and take some cheese if you intend to stay

Reviews.Title: “in need of refurbishment, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: happy898
Reviews.Content: Myself and friends have stayed at the Rho in previous years but won,t be staying again. It has become very run down and most areas of the hotel are in need of refurbishment. The high prices charged do not reflect the poor standard of the hotel. The location is excellent, just off dam sqare, but still not worth the prices charged. we stayed for one night and had to pay 25 euros to park our motorcycle in the garage ( charge not mentioned on booking! ) You also have to pay extra for air conditioning, appalling!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: ChefNz
Reviews.Content: The room was dark, damp with a musty smell. The bathroom was dirty with mould around the edges. The room looked a lot differant than the web picture. I would not advise anybody to stay there, it was in a good location but because of that it was noisy. The whole place was ready for a refit about 20 years ago. Most of the furnishings was from the 1960 including the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Not what their web site says”
Reviews.Author: NZBunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge dissapointment we were not given the type of room we had booked, it was dingy only two bedside lamps with 20 watt bulbs lit the rooms, it was so dark and dingy and smelled of smoke. Old 1960's red chenille bedspreads and lumpy old single beds. The bathroom had a quick clean not a thorough clean and it was grubby throughout the hotel. The towels you could alsmost see through. Where this hotel got 3 stars is beyond me. It was smelly and not even up to being a hotel standard of any sort.. No porter service offered (yes there is a lift but you have to still get up some awkward stairs that are not serviced by the lift.). We left and would not stay it was so bad. I think the people that say its good are dreaming or have exceptionally low standards. This hotel is pobably popular with the hoards of single men that go to Amsterdam for their recreation and don't see the grubbyness. It was expensive, we ended up in an international Hotel for only E10 extra a night which was excellent and spotlessly clean with attentive staff. We challenged our booking with the staff on duty at the Rho and they suggested that they bump some unknown man yet to arrive to give us a double room. I suspect that this is what had happened to us. They argued that we hadn't booked a double but I could produce my online booking form that I had requested a double and non smoking room and even repeated thisi n the comments box. They came back with well you hadn't confirmed- Hey I paid a nights deposit and got an email from them saying thanks- how many times do you need to confirm! This place needs a total refit of both the interior of the building and of the surly staff. Go elsewhere this place is just off Dam square and is probably very noisy if you are on the outer part of the building. Amsterdam is very small so you dont need to be on Dam square its only a short walk to anywhere. Another dissapointment in Amsterdam was the food. No variety and what is served up is pretty disgusting, Deep fried and chips with everything also an excuse for a salad is put on the side of the plate. The cafes/restaurants obviously don't expect any repeat trade.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: garryLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just spent a mid week break in Amsterdam at the RHO Hotel and could not fault it. The hotel is in a great location and easy to find.The rooms are a bit plain and tired looking but are clean and tidy ,the staff are friendly and helpful. We stayed B&B and again could not fault the Breakfast buffet: A good selection of hot and cold food that was continually topped up by the Waiters. If you are looking for a clean ,no frills hotel in the city center the RHO is certainly worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Floweredstick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me for location, comfort and courtesy - all of which I thoroughly agree. The Reception staff make this hotel. Give them all a pay rise.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CHRISLOU
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights found reception staff very helpful, room very clean could have done with more lighting . The location was perfect just off Dam Square and close to all amenities, caught the train from airport to centraal station and walked to hotel which took about 10 minutes.Breakfast was good, bacon scrambled egg , dutch pancakes,cold meats cereal, fruit. This isn't a 4 star hotel but i would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Basic Amenities”
Reviews.Author: DutchBostonTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel since the late 1980s, and they have consistently provided good basic service. The rooms are simple but clean. The staff is very helpful. They have their own indoor parking (an exception in Amsterdam) The location is absolutely the best possible for visiting Amsterdam. Pricing is very reasonable. Breakfast is basic, but does the job. If you are traveling on a budget, or expect to be out all day, I would certainly recommend this hotel. I had to be back in Amsterdam this March for a funeral. The hotel had a special free parking offer, which is amazing since street parking can run you â‚¬60 per day. Excellent room (could use more lights....) and friendly service. I knew I would be out all day, so a good, clean and safe hotel with a great location is what I needed, and what I got

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geminigem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago but couldnt remember the name and just found it on a travel website. Me and my partner stayed here for 3 nights, we were very happy with everything. Fantastic location, but noise was not an issue what so ever, very friendly staff, spotless room and really lovely bathroom. Room was very small but it did us. Amsterdam is such a brilliant city, you really shouldnt be any much time in your room! Went down for breakfast 1 morning, wasnt great but wasnt that concerned, so many places to eat right on your doorstep. All in all was a great hotel and we're not easy pleased!!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleFirefighter
Reviews.Content: Stopped here quite a few times for stag do`s and with the wifey. The rooms are a bit old fashioned but are a resonable size and comfy enough. The location is what make it, it`s in the centre and pretty much ideal for lovers or stagdoers. The fourth time we stopped there me and 2 friend shared a large apartment room which we didnt know about before. It was spot on for us. Got to say I cant relly knock this hotel the price is cheap, its a bit of a blast to the past but, you dont go to the Dam to look at nice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “summed in 3 words.....No not water”
Reviews.Author: paddyh117
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in January, and if you ignore the 80's decor, and the very very basic facilities.it's not that bad a hotel and certainly a good location - it's also relatively clean, however, it is the only hotel I've ever stayed in the didn't have hot water - i mean none. at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: raver10
Reviews.Content: My mother stays at this Hotel each and everytime she visits Amsterdam (3/4 times a year). On a shopping trip in December my partner and I decided to join her and away we went to Amsterdam. Location wise this Hotel cannot be faulted, it is just off Dam Square and everything is virtually on your door step. The Hotel itself from what I know is situated within a former train station of some sort, it is not quite Four Seasons but for the price you pay, what can you expect? The rooms are basic but have everything you require (bring your own iron if at all possible as you have to use a comunal iron and board under some rather strange stairs, very odd). The rooms are of a good size and we had a room facing into a central courtyard ( i would advise requesting one not inward facing, noise can be an issue). Breakfast is plentiful and is served over a good period of time. The one thing i would say is that the staff really make this Hotel, they are most accommodating i have to say. Extremely helpful and polite. I would return as really for this price you will not get better in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Ara1e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. It was a good experience. The hotel is one minute walking from Dam Square, in a street full of theaters. You can get there from Central Station walking (5 minutes), there're lots of restaurants just around the corner and you'll get to the red light district in only 2 minutes. Concerning the rooms, they are small but clean. We were at the third floor so we had a nice views of the roofs, but I guess if you stay at the 1st or 2nd floor it can be very dark... We asked for a double bed instead of twins, and we got it! The mattress was a little bit too soft and old, but we slept very well. The heating was very strong, and I took us three days to understand that, even if it was only 0Â° C outside at noon, we'd rather turn the heating off !! The bathroom was clean, the only problem was the bathtub (too high, I was sure I'd end up having an accident when getting out of it). There are no toilet accessories, just soap and shampoo. Don't forget your razors, toothpaste and similar stuff, for you'll get nothing there (you can buy them at the vending machines in the hall). There is an empty fridge in the room; you can buy drinks and chips at the vending machines by the reception desk. About the breakfast, it was very good. Pancakes, eggs, bacon, bread (different kinds), French patisseries (that was the only thing that wasn't restored when finished, so if you want some of those, be sure to be there before 8 am), fresh fruits, fruit salad, salmon, ham, cheese, sausage, cereals (only two kinds, muesli and corn flakes) different kinds of yogurts, hot beverages, orange and grapefruit juice (not fresh), butter, honey, jam and chocolate chips (very dutch thing, try them on your toast!!). One last thing, the hotel offers free internet connection (wi-fi), you just have to ask for your codes at the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for central location!”
Reviews.Author: euphoria777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. I was a little worried after reading some not so good reviews, but was pleased to find it was not as bad as some had made out. Our room was simular to your basic travel lodge style room, just missing the ketle, but it had a fridge. The room was cleaned everyday. The breakfast offered a selection of cereals/fruit/bread/meats/cheese/eggs/bacon, it was always hot and well stocked up! The hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly, we would stay here again, as for us the location was excellent, just on the corner of Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very !! good location...not bad for 3* ..good breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: rosa63
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, in the old part of amsterdam , walking distance to most local attractions, there are loads of food places to eat. The hotel has a great reception area, kind of 1920/30's feel, the rooms are pretty standard but clean, the bathroom were a good size again standard and clean. The breakfast room is airy and bright a very good range to choose for breakfast. For us this hotel is great for the short weekend breaks..recommend for anyone wanting something middle of the range for a short break!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: John_WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rho Hotel for three nights in October 2008, and I would stay there again. As many other reviewers have noted, the location is just about as good as it gets. The hotel is on a side street right off Dam Square, within easy walking distance to most tourist attractions. It's not cheap, but decent budget accommodations seem to be hard to find in this part of the city. The included breakfast was good, and the staff were generally polite. (Like most people in Amsterdam, they speak excellent English.) I didn't think that the hotel was particularly noisy, either in terms of street noise or noise from neighboring rooms. I could occasionally hear the people in the other room, however, and I imagine that this could have been a problem if those people had been noisier. There's a computer with internet access in the lobby, which is a big plus for those who don't feel like lugging a laptop around. I notice that the TripAdvisor icon for "free high-speed internet" is not filled in for this hotel. I'm not sure why this is (maybe the internet isn't high-speed--it did seem slow at times), but the internet is available and free. Note that the written directions on the hotel's website are incomplete: they tell you to go to Dam Square, but they don't tell you how to find the side street. Be sure to look at the website's map so that you know which way to go from the Square.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: matakan
Reviews.Content: we were a group of travellers at amsterdam. hotel location is at dam squre and its very closer to the red light district, coffee shops and shopping street kaiver straat, by walking its take 10 min to arrive leidseplein squre.. hotel breakfast a little bit poor but clean and taesty.. rooms has no airconditioning system, in summer time it might be a problem. staff are normal... if you wanna rent a bike, hotel is the worst way, they are renting for one day 20 euros but other bike renting companies around the dam squre renting bikes for 7 euros per day. hotel is just 10 min to the central train station by walking... from schipol air port to central train station the cost of train ticket 4.60 euros.. if you wanna vist volendam, marken, edam and monickendam twons you can find one day bus ticket from the tourist information center next of the central train station... arriva buses ll carry you up to those towns only 6 euros( cost of one day bus ticket)...

Reviews.Title: “It's a great mid price hotel”
Reviews.Author: shipsatsea
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the Rho. It's clean, good breakfast and fantastic reception staff. Rooms are small but that's the norm for Amsterdam. They are well maintained and decorated. The entrance is lovely and the hotel was apparently a jewellers in a previous life. The glass dome is a treat as you walk in. I can happily recommend it as a place to stay. Very central (but not noisy) to Central Station which picks up from the airport. The defining sound in Amsterdam is that of travel case wheels rumbling over cobbles! If you haven't been to Amsterdam then go - it's an utter delight of a city, small, friendly and a walk along the canals with a stop for hot chocolate can't be beaten!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vjcc80
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here for 2 nights. I must say the locatin is excellent. Just off dam Square at the begining of The Red Light District!!! Many shops, eateries and coffee shops near by. The rooms are a good size, nicely decorated and set out lovely. Really nice bathroom. TV in room. Breakfast wonderful and lots to choose from. I try and stay somewhere different every year that i go to Amsterdam but Id stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: madeiraaddict
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Rho Hotel from 7th - 11th September 2008. We were allocated room 2008 on the 2nd floor.(there is a lift) The ROOM was a nice size. It overlooked a residence, therefore you had to keep your curtains closed at night. The room was very dark, lack of lamps. On the skirting board below the bed, there was a spill stain, it had obviously been there for ages, not the cleanest hotel, but on first sight it looks ok until you really look. The BATHROOM reminded me of a fish market slab, there was very BAD MOULD around the shower and tiles, the shower was either v.hot or v.cold. They only provided shower/shampoo gel and some soap, would have expected more for the price. We had to chase the maid every day to leave us two bath towels,bath mat, toilet rolls and tooth mugs. For some reason she forgot to leave them, she was a 'shilling short.' BREAKFAST, this was a mixture of dried up cheese, rubber/cold scrambled eggs and over cooked bacon. When they refreshed the eggs, they threw them in from a distance, it was clear they could not care less. There was tinned fruit in syrup and runny yogurt. The bread was nice and fresh. The breakfast staff had a bad attitude problem, never a smile, they do not clear plates until you leave the table. The dishcloths they use to wipe the tables were a FILTHY GREY. It was very NOISY at NIGHTwith druggies shouting and scooters roaring, not a good nights sleep in 4 nights. The blanket was ripped and the beadspread was stained, the mattress had not been cleaned in ages, the dust on the TV had been there for months. THE FRIDGE had mould in it and was not very efficient. Upon check out, there was no 'thank you/goodbye' THE LOCATION WAS GREAT,NEXT TO DAM SQUARE AND TRAMS. The reception staff were pleasant enough. We would not stay there again, it is not worth the money, it is more a 2 star hotel. THE PILLOWS were very LUMPY, you can request some thicker ones, even so they are horrid. Not worth the money, we felt cheated. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL UNLESS ALL YOU WANT IS GOOD LOCATION. It is so basic. For the price I would have expected better service. Perhaps the Dutch are not known for their service! If you want a great place to eat, just turn the corner and eat in the Chinese,(the first one you come to, CANNOT REMEMBER THE NAME) it is great value. This is an honest review. I do not have any pohotos as we have been to Amsterdam before and there is a limit to how many pics you want to keep. Wish I had taken some of the mould in the bathroom though.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: BillInSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The Rho is wonderfully located just off of Dam Square. Most of the tourist attractions are an easy walk from the hotel (or take a tram to the outlying museums). The rooms were quite basic, but clean and perfectly acceptable. No AC, but the fans in the room were fine to sleep by. The staff were extrememly friendly and helpful, and the hotel is large enough that there were always a few people on duty to answer questions. Breakfast was superb and served in a bustling dining room overlooking Nes street. Easy walk with roller bags to and from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ZeCat
Reviews.Content: In total our stay at Rho was average...the location is fantastic right off Dam square so top marks there. However i felt that the hotel was a very basic 3 star and for Â£100 per night you were defintely paying for the location. That said when we wanted to move rooms (into the dble that we had booked rather than singles) we were moved the next day. The staff were always very friendly and helpful The rooms are basic; no air circulation unless you left the window open, very student like, manky blankets on the beds and could defintely do with modernising. Overall if you are just looking for a central place to crash then this hits the spot, but it is not even Travel lodge standard so if this is your minimum you may want to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: WalSue
Reviews.Content: The 3 star RHO hotel is just off one corner of the square on Nes. At one point, the building used by an old Amsterdam gold trading company and what is now the lobby and reception were once a theatre, built in 1908 in Art-Deco style. The balcony on the first floor offers a great view over the lobby. The room itself was a reasonable size but rather dark. The bathroom came with some sachets of shampoo and shower gel. I stayed here about seven years ago and the rooms are starting to look a little tired. My room was backing on to the lift shaft and it did get a bit annoying especially at night. In general, the soundproofing in the room wasnâ€™t that great. The room came with free Wi-Fi access and a safe. There were no tea/coffee making facilities but there was an empty fridge for your own drinks Apparently you could ask for hot drinks at reception. There are also vending machines in the lobby area. There was a reasonable choice at breakfast the next morning; salmon, cheese, cereal, tinned fruit, yoghurt, bacon, scrambled eggs, tea, coffee and orange juice. On check out, bags can be left at the hotel in a locked room. This was a lot better than many hotels I've stayed at were bags a just left in a corner of reception.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Rxman22
Reviews.Content: Satisfied with my 6 night stay this past June, SUPER friendly and helpfull staff, great breakfast, clean, and comfortable, great location. small beds ( as expected in Europe) no AC, again par for this class of hotel, room was a bit dark ( window opened to side of a building) but overall satisfied. very clean and functional bathroom, price was great at 99Euros/night. would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “getting better”
Reviews.Author: terryulsterman
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for the 3rd or 4th time over the years I have to say the Rho is getting much better. The rooms seem to have had a touch up and now appear much cleaner and brighter. The staff at reception are friendly and helpful as ever. Breakfast - well its edible and plentiful. THe location is the selling point - very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Terrible Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SimonLavall
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great position in Amsterdam just off Dam Square and ten minutes from Centraal Station. The Rho is spotlessly clean, with staff who could not do enough for you be it answering question about Amsterdam, the best places to go etc, I can not speak highly enough of them! We stayed there for my mates stag do and even when I found myself locked out of the room in just a towel due to high jinks no one complained or got the funnies with us. The only downside was the breakfast I went down looking forward to the bacon and scrambled eggs but, realised on the first mouthfull I had made the wrong choice it was minging!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: pobgrg
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, just across the street from Dam Square its close to all the main attractions. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but we have stayed in Amsterdam before so we expected that. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. No noise at night time from the street. Hotel breakfast is nice, bacon is very salty though! We spent 3 nights in the Rho hotel and would recommend it highly!!! We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Bobby86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location set one street back from 'Dam Sq'. It is also a 2 min walk to the top tourist attraction 'Madam Tusaurds'. The hotel itself offered everything i want a hotel to offer me when visiting Amsterdam, Me and my friend returned last night after a 4 day trip, we had an large size Twin Bedroom with a good size bathroom (which is rare for hotels in Amsterdam). The room had a nice size window which let in a huge amount of sunlight and 'background' noise from the city centre. Breakfast is pretty standard but substantial untill late lunch, breakfast includes; Scrambled egg, Bacon, Toast, canned fruit, a choice of cereal and orange/tea/coffee, the cup size for tea and coffee is small in the restaurant so i suggest taking a travel kettle with you for a proper cup in the morning when you wake up (There is a fridge in the room for milk, water, beer etc). The hotel is a 10 min walk from 'Centraal Station' (which you can get a train too direct from the airport). The hotel now operates a No Smoking Policy. I would recomend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Amsterdam who is not looking for expense & luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great base and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: lisaguk
Reviews.Content: This place is really basic so if you want luxury it isn't for you. My boyfriend and I went for two nights and had such a great time. The staff are really friendly and will do anything they can to help. The breakfast is basic but nice. The rooms are plain but clean and comfortable. Th ebst bit about this place is the location. You are seconds from the red light district, Royal Palace etc. And even the further attractions are within easy walking distance. A really great weekend so thanks to all at the Rho Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but does the job”
Reviews.Author: aber_james
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a basic hotel, but is clean, welcoming and friendly. Pretty good breakfast. Originally, we were given a double but staff were more than happy to shift us to a twin once we told them we weren't actually a couple. The room was not bad in size, and the en-suite was much larger than the walk-in cupboard I had rather been expecting. It is true that noise could be heard from Dam Square at night. We were at the front, practically overlooking the Square. However, the compensation is that it is a great location - bars and restaurants just around the corner, and a pleasant walk (if it's not raining as it was for us..!) through the city to the Museum Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: butterbloodvoodoo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location, and really, the location just can't be better. Although the price was a bit too high and the hotel IS NOT located on a quiet street as they claim (you could hear loud noise from outside through the night), it was really a nice hotel with friendly staff and good breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, priced right”
Reviews.Author: skburnt
Reviews.Content: Overall, me and my friends liked the RHO. The location right off Dam Square is great, and the lobby is pretty cool. I read some reviews beforehand about noise; the walls are pretty thin, but other than a little noise, we just didn't hear much. Also, I was really surprised by the large size of the room, plus the bathroom and tub were large as well. First time I've experienced that in Europe for under $175 a night... The free breakfast was pretty good too, so take advantage of it and save some $$$. Everyone was helpful and we really don't have any complaints. Would stay here again and probably will.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sg123Surrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location, just 10 minutes walk from the station and right on Dam Square. Other reviews mentioned rude staff but they were lovely and couldn't do enough for us. There certainly were no rodents and the hotel was extremley clean, and the bedrooms basic but comfortable (all linen/ towels clean). Will definatly stay again when I next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Beach_babe87
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel in december with my boyfriend and my parents. We arrived friday and stayed for the weekend. Wen we arrived the reception staff were very helpful and assisted to us rite away. They also said they had tried to get us rooms as close as possible (this being the same floor, around 2 corners, but luckily we wern't too bothered). The hotels location is excellent we couldnt have hoped for better, litrally 2 seconds from Dam square and the same from pubs and restaurants and about 30 seconds from the nearest coffee shop if your looking for that sort of thing. The rooms themselves were clean and well kept. It appeared to us that all the rooms were smoking rooms, but luckily you couldnt smell anything in any of our rooms. Occasionally you could smell it in the corridors but well this is Amsterdam an its legal so i guess you could get that in any hotel. The corridors as other people have mentioned are a little problem, you can hear everything in your room. But well it didnt spoil our sleep. Breakfast was included in the stay and wasnt bad compared to some i have been offered. The staff were quick in filling up the empty plates etc as an when they were empty. There wasnt a huge choice but i have found that quite common in european city hotels. The hotel was great for the money tho. If your looking for cheap, central and a good nights sleep this is the perfect place to stop.

Reviews.Title: “Rude employees and rodents”
Reviews.Author: super_kels
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a budget hotel and was fine with that, but things became unbearable when I made my way onto the floor I'd be staying on. I heard construction as soon as I got off the elevator and turned down the hall to find a fairly large mouse running down the hall. When it heard me approach, it ran under a nearby guest door. I went to the front desk to tell them a mouse on the fourth floor wasn't acceptable, and was told by the conceirge, "if you don't like mice, you should probably leave Amsterdam." With treatment like that and rodents free to roam the hotel, I left for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: ALLWRIGHTY
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The Rho before and feel it represents value for money. If you're wanting a deluxe hotel The Rho isn't for you, its a little basic but I found my room (no 326) spacious and clean. Breakfast was good with a reasonable choice and the staff were friendly. Each time I've stayed at the hotel I've noticed they have asked for payment on arrival, rather than on departure like most hotels I've stayed in. The best selling point for this hotel is the location, its approx 20 yards off Dam Square so you're really handy for the shops and restaurants on busy Damrak , and close to The Red Light District and Centraal Station so its very handy for visitors arriving by train. I paid â‚¬95 a night incl tax and breakfast, so i'd say thats decent value for a good location

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisjam27
Reviews.Content: Rho hotel is ideally situated in the centre of Amsterdam just off Dam Square. We stayed in a triple room, plenty of room. Very friendly and helpful staff. As a 3 star its very good value, the food was good for breakfast, the only down side was the bar in the hotel could not serve any beer, not a big problem as there are enough around.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rippo4u
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 8 Oct 2007 for four nights in a single room. Asked for a quiet non smoking room and got it on 4th floor. One side was the hotel corner, the other the service room so no next door problems. Some noise from the back street with shouting drunks at 3 am just one night but not enough to disturb ones sleep. Room size quite adequate and decent towels and shampoo and gels. Reasonable shower wet room with toilet and washbasin. Bed comfortable and crisp clean sheets. Blanket not duvet. Top quality new curtains. Breakfast room pleasant. Good selection and reasonable quality. Hot scrambed eggs, boiled eggs (Hard), bacon, rice. Lots of bread choice. The best was slice your own from a choice of two fresh loaves. Two cerials, tinned mixed fruit, peaches, yoghurt, cheese, ham, butter, marg, jams, orange and grapefruit juice and superb really hot coffee. Only crit is that scrambled eggs are overcooked and come as omlette tough. Staff and service really good. There is a small bar but it is not really used as there is so much to choose from nearby. Good safe store room to leave baggage. Location is just right. I would stay here again without question as it is so easy to take a tram for one stop from Centraal Station or walk for 10 minutes. Lots of eating places all over this great city. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The Rho....very comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: norn-iron-lass
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the rho hotel in amsterdam for three nights at the end of september!! location...fantastic...it was so easy to find as it was right beside dam square and a 5-10min walk from the cenral station!!! the staff were very friendly and helpful (even when i managed to lock the safe, not able to open it!!!) check-in was quick, 24hr reception was fantastic...you could leave your key in at anytime!! the bedroom was clean & comfortable, but im glad there was a fan in the room....it got very warm quickly!! the ensuite was nice and big!!! the bedroom had its own safe that you made up ur own code for...which was very good!! the continental breakfast was fantastic...kept us goin to well into the middle of the day!!! only had one problem, as a non-smoker and used to the smoking ban in N.Ireland, i disliked people smoking in the lobby...especially in the morning when heading down for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money...”
Reviews.Author: plugster
Reviews.Content: A group of us went to amsterdam for my b.friends 30th birthday so we just wanted a clean hassle free place to stay, I would recommend this hotel if you want somewhere comfortable and in the middle of everything... the staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was good. We requested rooms to the back of the hotel as Dam square can be noisy. Some of the rooms are a little narrow but we just wanted somewhere to sleep! Would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sun-lover1984
Reviews.Content: we payed a good and low price to stay at this hotel so you cant expect 5* standards. For a hotel situated right next to dam square it was fantastic. The entrance to the hotel is very large and airy and the hotel staff were extremly friendly. When we arrived we found a lightbulb not working in our room we called reception and in 5 mins a new one arrived. The rooms are basic but comfortable and we heard no noise what so ever. The location is fantastic we walked onto dam sqaure an it was about 10 yards from the corner. fantatic location for shops bars and eating places. Breakfast was nice and the times were great 7-10.30 so when we had slept in we could still make it and when we had an early flight we could still make breakfast. Amsterdam was great and when i go back i will definatly stay at the Rho. I recommend this to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tw25rw
Reviews.Content: My 1st time at this hotel. Have had better, but also much much worse in numerous trips to Amsterdam. Room was comfortable but not luxurious and adequate for me. Generally a good, if slightly tired, budget hotel. Never up in time to eat. Noise outside the biggest downside, and a few local dregs hanging round. Paying up front is usual in budget hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Don't recomend”
Reviews.Author: shawana80
Reviews.Content: It was easy to find, right off of Dam Square (good location). Something I found strange was that they made me pay for the full stay on check in (?) The hotel was such a disapointment; dark hallways, dark rooms, no AC just a fan, musty smell, unlike one of the pics I saw our bathroom didn't have a shower basin just a curtin and the water would splash all over the floor, the safe worked but we found a used bottle of lubricant in it :( ewwwww, there was a note on the window that said not to open it for safety purposes so we didn't then one night we came back and found it wide open!!! there were many drug dealers in the area which i found scary. On a lighter note the bed was comfortable, and the breakfast was ok. I do not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: HWinSF
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8-nite stay. The rooms were somewhat small, and the "decor" minimal, but they were clean and comfortable. GREAT mattresses. We stayed first in a front room and it was noisy at night due to street noise from The Dam. Went out at midnite to see what all the ruckus was, but it was just people sitting out in cafes talking, and a band at one cafe. Felt very safe. We moved to a room at the back and it was very quiet. Breakfast was wonderful, with a choice of English/American or Dutch. Everything you could want. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Look around for a better hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HappydaysIreland
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is okay but a lot of local tugs hang around at the side of this hotel.They make a lot of racket at night and sleeping at this hotel is not easy. We didn't eat breakfast because it looked so bad.Rooms are dark and stank of fags. The safe did not work in any of the rooms we stayed in. The staff didn't really seem to interested in any thing we asked of them. We booked our taxi from reception to the airport , got a price and then were charged an extra â‚¬15.00.If your hotel is important to you when you travel do not stay ay the rho hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: carmenrome
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from Amsterdam and the Rho. First the good: excellent location. Breakfast OK, no complains there, rooms clean, but the noise level from the other rooms was a little too much. One can hear the person in the next room snore, the one above walk and everybody else slam doors. If that is not an issue, the hotel is great. For the right price, I would return in spite of the noise. Also, you will be asked to pay for the entire stay at arrival, which for us, for a week was over 1000 Euro and to leave the key at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: GrahamScotland
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel,rooms clean but furnature old & inadequate for todays traveller. Very noisy at night because of its position in the city & all the drug taking ect. Breakfast very good & management helpfull. Hotel rooms need major refurbishment. Do not use Connexxion airport shuttle, they are not to be relied on.Use the train to and from airport.

Reviews.Title: “RHO great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SueMSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great location and well priced. Very clean and room not bad size.Staff were very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: ctr-babe
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location,just off of Dam Square,hotel was very clean,staff were friendly,dont think the chef could cope with the breakfast "rush" as nothing seemed 2 b topped up quick enough,but that said the food was pleasent enough!
