Just b aware of the drug dealers that always seemed 2 b outside the hotel offering "something 4 ure nose" that said they did take no! 4 an answer everytime they asked, would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: jryeaman
Reviews.Content: Good hotel right in the centre of Amsterdam, a little nosiy at night but we were in the middle of town. Room was small but clean. Breakfast was good with a variety of food om offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: spaldingrambler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and found it to be an excellent location for walking around the sights of Amsterdam. Easy to get to from Central Station, about a five minute walk. Arrived late at night but felt quite safe walking with suitcase from station. Hotel just metres from Dam Square. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and tidy, everything available except kettle to make a hot drink. Although close to Dam Square, no noise could be heard in room. Breakfasts were very good and plenty of choice. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Would certainly stay there again if visiting Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “nice breakfast thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: bl0ndie26
Reviews.Content: got a great size room,and were delighted,but that soon passed when we tried to go asleep that night..we were put next to the staff room of hotel and constant banging of door kept us awake all night.(room 105) clean towels only giving once on 3 day visit,we had no clean towels left on last nite.bring a hairdryer,they say they have one in room but its not worth using.i would pay the extra money in future to stay in a higher star hotel,it is a holiday after all!

Reviews.Title: “Think it was brill!”
Reviews.Author: dirtycellar
Reviews.Content: As it says in the title, I think this hotel was good. Nah, it was good. It was perfectly located and perfectly priced for what we wanted. It was a 21st birthday weekend for a friend. 6 of us went in total. The hotel was located just off Dam Square on a small side street. I think the place was huge because our room looked out onto another street all together. The room was small, with 2 single beds pushed together as a double. There was a TV and a small en suite. The room was clean and warm. Considering its location fairly cheap also, but we did book direct with the hotel so saved a bit there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: RoversFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days in November 2006. Best thing about the hotel is its location - smack bang in the middle of town and the reasonable price. Rooms are clean but a bit basic, showers the same. Breakfast isn't that good, couldn't really face it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: momideerst
Reviews.Content: We spent Nov. 2 thru 8 at the RHO Hotel and would absolutely book there again on our next trip to Amsterdam. The staff is very helpful - especially with directions and also with frank appraisal of some of the local eating establishments. They never once gave us bad information. Our room is typical of Europe - small! But, we expected that. The room was cleaner than many American hotels we have stayed in! (the location is terrific - easy walk to shopping and museums) Here are some key points: 1. take care with the hot water - take time to adjust the temperature (very common problem in European hotels), but not a big problem is you are aware of it. 2. the bathroom was adequate in size and appointment. Soap and shampoo are furnished. 3. Internet connection available in the lobby for 2.50 per half hour (in Euro's). 4. Staff at desk is friendly and more than happy to insure you have a good visit. 5. the beds are softer than we are used to, but after you have spent the day walking Amsterdam, you won't even care. We didn't think it was a big deal. 6. Breakfast was just fine! Hot scrambled eggs, hot rice with green and red peppers, muffins, toast, cheeses and (canned) fruit and cereal were more than adequate. Much better than the usual continental breakfasts. (Turn right upon exiting the hotel and right again at the corner...go half a block to Rene's pastries if you are still hungry). Note: 2 great places to eat (just off the Liedseplein Square) The Hole In The Wall (Irish Pub) - try the fish and chips; and Hard Rock Cafe (lunch is very reasonable and you get TWO sandwiches - so be sure to ask first and 2 people can share one lunch). For the money, it was a good bargain and we will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: RGYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Three good points: 1. Very central location just off the Dam Square - ideal for all the sights. 2. The staff are friendly and helpful. 3. The standard of cleanliness is good However! 1. The rooms are quite small and ours on the fourth floor had a sloping ceiling which made it impossible to get into or out of bed without having to stoop (and I'm only average height). 2. The walls are very thin - conversation from adjoining rooms could be easily heard. 3. The overall quality is basic - not even a 'do not disturb' hanger for the door - and the room attendants do start quite early. 4. Our room only had a shower and the shower 'well' is so shallow the water easily goes all over the floor. 5. Although we had booked a double in a no-smoking room some weeks in advance when we arrived we were allocated a twin. The only alternative was a double in a smoking room. Their allocation procedure seemed to be a mix of computer and written sheet - not very efficient. 6. Breakfast was also basic - yes there is bread, preserves, fruit etc. but the bread was virtually all toasting bread, the preserves were of a poor quality and the fruit consisted of tinned fruit cocktail, tinned pear halves and very little else. There was also thinly sliced ham but some nice Dutch cheese. If you are bothered more about quantity than quality then you can stoke up for the day but not with anything special. 7. There were some cooked items - however, the only eggs were scrambled. If they were fresh into the hot containers then that was fine but they appeared to be kept over a dry heat so quickly dried out and became very unappetising. To be fair whilst the hotel appeared busy and whilst we ate breakfast at different times during our stay we did not encounter any queues nor had a problem getting a table. We only noticed 1 lift but had no problems during our stay. There is a baggage room and the reception staff were very helpful with us leaving our bags on the day of departure. Overall the firm with whom we booked the break to Amsterdam described the RHO as 3* superior. Our view is it more 3* basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - shme about the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Something-Different!
Reviews.Content: The Rho hotel is in a fantastic position - just off Dam Square down a side street. The main foyer is very ornate and looks a bit like an old Victorian Train Station. Our main gripe was the room. It was very small with little space to put your suitcase out. The rooms look like they have been split into smaller sizes and of course this makes the corridors etc very difficult to navigate as they wander around all over the place. We were on the first floor and at first got the lift up to our room. We decided to walk up the stairs the next day and couldn't find our room and so had to backtrack to the lobby. Again, because the rooms have been split the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything above, below and beside you. At the end of the day, this was not a luxury hotel - but we weren't expecting one! It was clean and basic and even with the funny room we enjoyed our holiday and would recommend it as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnehall
Reviews.Content: Really wonderful clean hotel. Fantastic position near to just about everthing. Staff were really good and friendly. Our room was absolutely spotless. So quiet at nights. The breakfast was really good and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Eh... Not Great, not terrible”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynPS
Reviews.Content: We booked on the basis of a review in our guidebook (Rough Guide). Having booked a non-smoking room for 3 nights, we arrived to be told that only smoking rooms were available, but that we could move to a non-smoking room for the second and third night. We agreed, since the alternative was to schlep around looking for another hotel. The smoking room was vile - almost unbearable. The non-smoking room was fine, clean but threadbare, with a gigantic bathroom. The rooms had very basic furnishings, carpets etc., and felt very flimsy. Each of the two rooms were very different in size and shape. Both rooms were at the back of the hotel and the non-smoking room was on an upper floor. Both were pretty quiet, in terms of both hotel noise and street noise. The stafff were helpful and friendly, although the lobby was more train-station-like rather than comfortable and welcoming. We didn't pay a huge amount, so we were happy with what we got, but it was certainly oversold by the guidebook review. If you're looking for a budget place to sleep, this was fine. If you're looking for a nice place to stay as part of a romantic weekend away, this is not the place to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe some of the reviews here”
Reviews.Author: GillB
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly at the Rho. As a single female, I always feel safe there. The staff couldn't be more helpful; the single rooms aren't cubby holes; there's a safe, fan and fridge in all the rooms I've stayed in; breakfast is plenty for me, including fresh-squeezed orange juice. Only downside is that the (preferable) outer rooms can be noisy with the window wide open because of the wretched tourists in Dam Square until all hours of the morning. But, all in all, for a mid-priced, comfortable hotel which is absolutely in the centre of things, it's hard to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Bounsty
Reviews.Content: This is clearly not a 3 star hotel ! The staff is rather unpleasant, decoration is inexistant, rooms are tiny and beds are too soft, no air conditioning in the rooms which are just under the rooftop, and to finish breakfast is mediocre (no croissants or pancakes only bread, no choice in fruit juices etc...). The only good point is its location right on the Dam place.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BABA2000
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, just of the Dam Square. Some other reviewers have been critical of the accommodation and staff. True, it is not exactly plush, but the rooms were clean, the public areas pleasant, and it was excellent value for money. Staff v helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Amsterdam and discovered there was no way I was going to stay 4 nights in the hotel I had booked from home. So, on my way to find a new hotel for the same day, the RHO was one of the few hotels that could take me. If you want a hotel room that is clean, equipped with a bathroom, tv, phone, and safe - the Rho is fine. Nothing special, but it does the job. My main complaints are these: the walls are thin, so you hear any noise. If you're there in the summer, there seems to be no air conditioning, and the room can get really hot. They have a storage room to hold your luggage the day you leave, but this is totally unsafe as anyone can go in and take any luggage. And, finally, be careful about how they charge you. I was over-charged for one night by a particular staff member who knew I had nowhere to stay (despite the other reviews, I didn't find all the staff that hospitable; some were, some were not). When I went to pay the next morning, I luckily was saved by another staff member who couldn't undersatnd why i was over-charged 50 euros. Overall, considering other hotels I came across in Amsterdam, I would give the Rho another try, aware of the problems above. Oh, and just down Nes, a few steps from the hotel really, there is a great pub/cafe. Awesome food, staff, ambience. Give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rho...........perfect for us three”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello to all review readers. Me and my 2 friends went to amsterdam and stayed on the 30th of june till the 2nd of july 2006 for the id&t sensation white event at the amsterdam arena, and our choice of hotel was the hotel rho. On first impression when we found the doorway into the hotel, we were all very impressed with how clean, tidy and very presentable the place was. It is a converted museum or hall or something because the main reception is huge and very grand looking. We were welcomed by a nice lady who spoke great english and who booked us in and gave us our door card to room 111 which was at the back of the hotel. We entered the room to be impressed again which was very clean and tidy with all amenities inc: tv, bath/shower, towels, wardrobe with hangers, fridge, fan, hairdryer, table and chairs, bedside lamps, full length mirror, big wide opening window (although never any breeze) and not to forget 3 very nicley made soft clean comfy beds. The next morning we all went to breakfast and again we were all very impressed with the buffet they had put on. The range to pick from was tremendous, oh my they had it all except slice sausage and tattie scone, which we soon forgot about because of the choice we had in front of us. So all in all this hotel was absolute perfect for 3 lads going to amsterdam for the weekend. Dont get me wrong it was not 5 star high class swanky town, but it was defo above average and very clean and presentable. It was great value for money, just for that little feeling of security and comfort, and it is perfectly located just 2 steps from dam square which is the main centre point of amsterdam. I wish i had photos of the hotel to show you, but no dought you will see if you are looking for hotels on the websites. Just like to add, the 5 friends we went with decided to stay in a cheaper hotel/hostel and let me tell you, it is not worth it at all. Their room was like small squashed army barracks with broken crappy beds, tiny bathroom, didnt look and feel clean and just had that dodgy feeling about it. Pay that tiny little bit extra for comfort and security and you will get it at this hotel, which we will definetley be back at, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a look”
Reviews.Author: SugarStar
Reviews.Content: We were please with our stay, very friendly staff who were only to happy to help, good sized room and great breakfast. But as with all hotels there were a few faults. Beds were very soft, we were on the 4th floor so it was very hot, could of done with air conditioning. We had to leave the window open all night and, as we looked out onto a street, we could hear loud music and people leaving bars at all hours of the night. There also seemed to be a shortage of large towels which lead to us asking at reception repeatedly. For the amount of time we actually spent in the room though it was fine for us and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: a happy trip advisor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rho @ the end of May. It had been recommended by a friend.The hotel was clean,our room was fairly small, no view at all, a roof and another roof!! The bathroom sink leaked and the showerhead just flopped to one side.The room was quiet considering it was backing onto the lift.The breakfast was good and plentiful.A fairly average hotel, excellent location.One thing did however bother us,on our final night about half one in the morning,a man came into our room!He had obviously got the wrong room but his plastic key fob had given him access into our room! We informed the staff the next morning who said they would check and change the code.I personally wouldn't go back and stay at the Hotel Rho.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, but silly payment policy”
Reviews.Author: AName
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RHO hotel for 3 days in May 2006 and overall was happy with the hotel. We stayed on the top (4th) floor in room 440. The room itself was large and clean, with a reasonably large sized bathroom. Being the top floor, the corridor had a Dutch style sloping roof, but the room did not. The room looked inward into a courtyard (of sorts), so there was little external noise, but also little ventilation. This resulted in having to keep the window wide open 24 hours just to get some cool air â€“ this would be a big problem in the hot summer â€“ so maybe ask for a street view room Booked directly on hotel website and for a twin room, we paid 130 euro per night for midweek and 155 for weekend. By Amsterdam standards this represents average to good value for the quality of hotel. Positive things: - Location â€“ just off Dam Square on Ness Street is great. - Reasonably big bedroom and bathroom size - Reasonably good value for money - Good breakfast choice - In room safe Negative things: - Room very hot / poor ventilation - Floorboards very squeaky - Hot water fluctuated hot/cold in shower on occasions - Only 1 lift, so had to wait a lot - In need of decor update - Sheets and heavy blankets, not duvets on bed - Beds very soft - Not very secure luggage store (for leaving luggage when check out) - Silly payment policy Final note on payment policy: I booked using my credit card and paid 50% bill up front on arrival using my credit card. However, on the last night, when we returned at 3am our room locks had been changed and the night porter refused to let us in unless we paid the outstanding balance there and then. He told us this was standard Dutch policy â€“ which it is not. I complained the following morning and got an apology from the duty manger, who said it was a misunderstanding. I was annoyed by this â€“ as implication was we would â€˜do a runnerâ€™ without paying out bill. However, the apology was sufficient. Overall, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the RHO Hotel, situated right on Dam Square. Pleasant hotel, a lick of paint would be nice but otherwise OK. The room we were given was huge, could easily have slept 6, staff very helpful. If you visit this area I must tell you about THE best place to eat. Its called 'van Kerkwijk' and is situated down the street from the RHO hotel (entrance to hotel in side street). It is nothing fantastic to look at but you will not get a better meal anywhere on Dam Square. The food is outstanding. The best time to get a table is about 6.00 p.m. or you will have to wait in a queue, but believe me, the wait is worth it, fantastic tasting food and great staff. Give it a try, you will not be dissapointed. Hope you enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stopped here in Jan/Feb 2006 mainly due to its location which is excellent, the breakfast is spot on, the staff nice and polite (the guy that cleans the rooms was cool with me leaving a baggie or two on the table!) the only thing that let it down for me was the thin walls but luckily our neighbours weren't too noisy! Going back in May!

Reviews.Title: “B+ / A-”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, we liked the Rho Hotel and would probably stay there again. The location was unbeatable, fotsteps away from Dam Square. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. They were great. The breakfast was very good as well. We stayed in 2 different non-smoking rooms there because we left on a trip out of the city and then came back. The first room was a double and was quite small. Of the two slanted windows, one had a missing blinds and the other a broken blind. The mattress had pretty much no support. The second room, however, had 2 twin beds and was much larger and nicer. The hotel was quiet, but we were told that the smoking rooms were not as quiet. Also, I'm not sure if you'd need to open the windows in the summer because I'm not sure if they have a.c. I'm not sure what the noise level would be like with open windows. Of course, I've stayed in much nicer hotels, but for the price and location, this one is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after arriving in amsterdam to see that the hotel i made reservations at was non-existant, a kind man showed me and my 2 friends to the Rho Hotel and said he liked it. WOW! its a very interesting looking hotel, the GM is a great guy who cut us a great deal on a 4 person flat for 9 days. If it weren't for that hotel, AND THEIR AWESOME BREAKFAST, our trip wouldn't have been nearly as sweet ;) I now call the Rho Hotel my "home away from home"!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: roland martin
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews before travelling I completely disagree about the staff. They were all friendly, helpful, and had a good sense of humour! The breakfasts were good, and it was all very easy. The location is convenient. The hotel was warm; it was freezing outside. Big rooms with all you would expect in a city centre hotel in this category. I would be happy to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to Amsterdam and we would def reccommand the Rho Hotel for location and Hospitality shown by all the staff.Rooms are basic with no tea or coffee making facilities but it did have its own fridge for drinks.Rooms were so warm even in bitter cold Feb that we had to open our window at night and walk in shower was something else with always piping hot water.Breakfast offered a great choice of cooked or continential.Location is ideal for shopping 1 min away and not forgetting the Red Light District and other bars and restaurants only walking distance away.We will def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: NLR1
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Rho for a weekend break with 5 friends. Girls weekend (though all 40 something. Ideal location to see all the sights of Amsterdam, easy to know where the horel is as it's next to the big yellow clog shop on Dam Square.I had read some Rho hotel reviews on this web site and it wasn't as bad as some people make out. Plenty of hot water, though no bath in my room. Breakfast was fine with plenty to choose from and yes it was the same each day but there was enough choice to vary your own menu.Tea & coffee facilities would be next in the room, though I'm told by the senior desk staff that isn't classed as 3* in Holland ( I was in Madrid last week ans stayed in a superior 3* to the Rho & no T or C facilities in the room there either.) Yes it is a bit noisy and quite alot of singles and younger groups staying there, but all in all it was value for money and ideal for visting such a strange city as Amsterdam.Not the hotel I would choose for a romantic w/end away with my husband but definately suitable for a w/end visit with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The worst "Hotel" I have ever stayed in. I would not recommend it to my Dog. The major problem being the staff at reception, and in the breakfast room. A good course in customer service would not go astray here, I found most of them rude and unhelpful. I have been to Amsterdam 3 times this year, and have never come away with an impression like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carl_Wirral
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel situated right in the middle of everything in Amsterdam (5 mins walk from station). The rooms are basic but just what is needed on a budget break: Good size, comfy beds, tv, safe, telephone (made a 35 min peak time call back to the UK and it only cost 4 euros, bargain!) and most importantly of all - it`s clean (Although no tea and coffee). Didn`t experience any problems with noise but I suppose it depends what part of the hotel you are in. Breakfast is a buffet of bacon, eggs, cereal, toast, meats etc. but there is plenty of it which sets you up for the day, and it`s served until 10.30. Staff are very friendly and welcoming, nothing is too much trouble, they really make for a pleasant stay. If you arrive expecting luxury then you`ll be disappointed, but for a good value, centrally located budget hotel the Rho is perfect, and I`ll stay here on every trip to Amsterdam. Also previously stayed at the hotel Rokin (Owned by same family as the Rho) just down the street so if the Rho is full try them.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine!”
Reviews.Author: gadgetgrrl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet yet central location with interesting things to do in every direction - this is your place. We stayed in room 481, which was on the top floor in the corner closest to Dam Square... where we could actually pick up a free wireless connection (no, not part of the hotel services). From peeking in some other double rooms, I'd have to say our room was quite a bit larger than average. The room was on the basic side, but had everything we really needed... clean, very good bathroom, tv that works, NO road noise, room safe, fan, windows that open, and refrigerator. There were two twin beds shoved together with end tables on each side, a couple of small but cushy chairs, and some small tables. A friend travelling with us had a single room, which he said was tiny. I don't remember seeing any shampoo/conditioner in the bathroom, so bring your own. The breakfast was free but totally uninspiring. There's a nice outdoor coffee/pub/food place right on the corner if you want something different. (It turns out there's an excellent wireless signal from there as well.) I can't help but think of all those poor people staying at the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky a half block away that were paying triple what we were paying, and putting up with so much more noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,the rest very dissappointing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 7th Sept 05 to 9th Spt 05. The hotel is fabulously located, unfortunately thats all I can say in favour of it. We hate to complain, however, when we checked in we were given room 228, Ok, the window would not stay open and in that humidity and the hotel had no ventialtion hardly and was very hot and airless we complained. The hotel receptionist asked "could we prop it open with a book?" (how dangerous could that be if it fell from the 2nd floor straight down on to the street?) We advised the reception of this and they said "well we do not know what else we can do for you". To our rescue came the manager and moved us to roon 232 which was fine and had a window that opened. The location as I said is Fab, however there are so many more situated in the same area, I do not recommed this hotel!! I do though recommend Amsterdam, we love it!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Own Water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Rho Aug 05. First impression was ok, nothing special, although the huge lobby area was somewhat misleading as to what to expect once you get up to your room. The room we stayed in (229) had no running cold water, the window was broken, which meant that it could not be locked once we left the room and the layout was terrible. We had to move the furniture around to get some form of normality in the room. After telling the receptionist about the water problem, we were told some1 will come up to have a look. And that's exactly what happened, some1 came up and had a look. THAT'S IT. Again, highlighting our concerns to the hotel, we were told that they could provide us with A BUCKET OF COLD WATER. Oh we were also offered 10 euros discount for the three nights we were there. What a joke. I'm sorry, going on about this place is really starting to remind me of the black cloud of my trip across the continental Europe. So to conclude, this is a LOUSY PLACE to stay. Find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam6680
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the RHO hotel for one night in August 2005. I arrived around 0930 am and to my suprise the single room i had booked was available. There is a lift, my room was on the second floor. once i found the room, you have to go around a maze of doors and corridors to find your room.. not wasy when you return after a skin full of Beer. I had a nice large bath, with shower, toilet, sink. etc, the only thing which let the bathroom down was the lighting... The lighting only came from the saving mirror above the sink. I had a TV, and a view of the side street, if you put your head out of the window you could see Dam Square. The room had a safe in the wardrobe, which you enter a 4 digit number to use. The bed was clean as was the room overall. There is a buffet breakfast which i never did get to see, a small bar also. the hotel does have a web site you can look at. The Staff where pleasent. and they looked after me. There is a room to lock your bag away pre or after check out until you depart the hotel. check out was 1100am. all in all, i would stay there again. The hotel is great for the Red light district, China town, area. Central Station is around half a mile away 10 minute stroll up Damrak. The floating flower market is about 1/2 mile down Rokin, in the opposite direction. Dam Square is twenty five yards away.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to centre of city and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Nic-DC
Reviews.Content: Just off Dam square - so very handy for bars and restaurants and tram stop, about a half hour walk from central station. You couldn't hear any noise from traffic or from passers by as is on a quiet street. Nice lobby but quite basic rooms. TV had very bad reception and there is no airconditioning just a table fan. Our room seemed to be in a converted attic space so had a sloping ceiling and was quite warm. Room was clean, with a normal sized double bed and not much else in it. En-suite bathroom was pretty basic and not that modern but seemed clean. Breakfast was ok, some of the cooked items such as bacon and scrambled eggs seemed a little overdone and had been sitting a while. Pretty good value though and great if all your after is a bed in a centrally located hotel and not worried about the usual 4 or 5* luxuries. Would rate this hotel as a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: CaptnHook
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 6 different tourist class (2-3 star) hotels in Amsterdam Centrum between 2001 to 2003. I stayed at Rho Hotel in my last 3 visits. I found this hotel offers the best value for the price and location. This is the hotel if you want to be near Dam Square at a reasonable price . The rooms meet Amsterdam standard for a tourist class hotel. It is true the wall may be thin, you can hear footsteps as people walk by the hallway outside your room, and the street noise can last until 5 am when the drunks return from the bar. They do not bother me afterall this is Amsterdam!!! The free hot breakfast is good. The hotel staff always say hi when I walk by the lobby (except the really hot looking blonde girl who seems has never greeted me). Again, for Amsterdam hotel standards in the Centrum, I have not found a better hotel for the price. If anyone has a better suggestion for a single room with private bathroom for less than 100 Euro (including VAT/service charge and hot breakfast for weekend days) I would like to know about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend and thought it was great for a basic hotel. The location was what sold it to us and it didn't let us down - slap bang opposite the big dept store on dam square. The breakfast was good - although when it got busy it was quite hectic as not a lot of room at the buffet - and set us up for the day so avoiding the need for lunch! The only thing that let it down was the room - perfectly adequate but like previous people have said, had wafer thin walls (think office partitioning rather than walls). Room was clean, functional and had comfy bed and spacious enough bathroom but there was no feeling of luxury at all - felt quite like a travellodge room but with less sturdy walls! Overall I would recommend to friends but only for less than say Â£80 a night per room - anymore than that and i'm sure you could get more for your money!

Reviews.Title: “basic rho hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rho Hotel & were delighted with how close it was to Dam Square. The Hotel itself however is very basic & our room was really dark.There was no mini bar as advertised and the TV was useless. It was very clean though which is the main thing. There is nothing special about this Hotel at all but it really was in a great location if like us you are there for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This converted theatre is now a basic economy class hotel. Staff is helpful and rooms are small but clean and safe. One thing that disturbed me was the noice level. Walls are thin and you can hear if your neighbor is snoring. On the plus side, it's a great location just next to the Dam. Also, if you fancy a great hotel bar, just walk to 5-star hotel Krasnapolsky located less than a minute walk from Rho. As usual, you get what you pay for. Rho is good value for money, but if you expect anything better than a economy class hotel, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rho, its fine”
Reviews.Author: triumphant
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for three times now. It is a fine hotel if you are not expecting luxory. Its a old building (formally a theatre i think) and maybe the rooms need a freshen up. They are fine, most are roomy, tv etc. Bathrooms are on the large side in most rooms. Staff are young people and very nice and chatty, and are a good laugh!! We find the front of hotel over looking the square can get a bit noisy if you plan a early night, so request a room at the rear. Breakfasts are the same as you would find anywhere in amsterdam, cold meats, cheese, boiled eggs and scrambled eggs, bacon, fruit etc etc, it is all tasty and plenty of it. All in all the RHO is a decent hotel, central and handy.

Reviews.Title: “loved it very friendly”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghDelboy
Reviews.Content: very pleasant hotel, staff very friendly and nothing too much trouble, we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: darkjedi23
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Amsterdam and our second stay at the Rho hotel. My girlfriend and I were very happy with the room and the hot buffet breakfast that was delicious on both occasions. The location is excellent, right on Dam square, next to the shops and the vibrant nightlife. We will be going to Amsterdam again soon and when we do we'll be definitely staying at Rho.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but didn't like the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 16 day trip through Europe (Paris, Amsterdam and Germany). The Rho Hotel was the only hotel I was disappointed in of the 5 hotels we stayed at during our travels. You can't beat the location. It's right off Dam Square, but..... They allowed smoking in the lobby of the hotel, which although very European, was tiresome as an American, and the stale smoke was not pleasant on the way to breakfast every morning. The floors in the hallways were super-creaky, and in our room, I felt like I should wear the paper slippers they provided b/c the floor didn't seem clean. The bathroom felt unclean as well. I was glad there was a safe in the room, and I was even more glad when it was time to leave for Germany!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 3*** hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was very dark as there was only a small window. Maybe it was better not to see walls that were pretty cruddy. A lamp was broken that was never fixed even we asked for it. And we didn't have a minibar in the room (which was "forgotten" as per the staff). A hotel not to recommed! The only good thing is the location if you like bars/restautants around the corner. On the other hand there are hundreds of bars EVERYWEHRE in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel for the money. Spotless rooms, very friendly staff, perfect location, breakfast served 'til 10.30, highly recommend bike hire from hotel - look to be best available to hire locally-. Also recommend 1st bar, out the door, turning left. The ''NES cafe''. locals bar, nice sounds, beer a third of the price of tourist bars and a v.nice menu

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fenner
Reviews.Content: Some of theb staff were very un-helpfull, they would make remarks and laugh about you in front of you. Rooms were not what we had booked. Bathroom smelt of sewer. The hotel is in desperate need of decorating and updating!!

HotelInfo.Name: RHO Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: NES 05-23, Amsterdam 1012 KC, The Netherlands
